results.description:
https://youtu.be/Sgl3PqnNbyI

Are you a Foreign National who is passionate about launching or furthering your career in the United States? 

Are you a foreign student, graduate, or tourist looking to remain in the US and work? Are you a current H1B VISA holder looking to switch jobs?

Click here to Buy Tickets 

NY Career Meetup will  get answers for these tough topics and much more!

</a><a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/h1b-jobseeker-roundtable-complete-understanding-of-h1-b-visa-and-getting-job-sponsorship-in-the-usa-tickets-20365263050">Click here to Buy Tickets 

Join us for an exclusive, information-packed Roundtable event, with an experienced immigration lawyer, recruiters, a career coach, lots of experience, and one agenda: How to get job sponsorship in the US.

Who Should Attend?

Those ambitious job seekers looking for savvy, inside info on the A to Z's of understanding H1Bs and getting job sponsorship in the US, including:

-What is the H1B work visa program?

-What is the process to acquire to acquire an H1B (costs, timelines, F1 to H1B, employer requirements)

-Types of companies that generally hire H1Bs

-How to market yourself smart in your H1B-focused job search

-How consulting companies and H1Bs work

-Employer bonds for H1Bs

-H1B renewals

-Next steps after H1B – Green Card, etc.

And more!

</a><a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/h1b-jobseeker-roundtable-complete-understanding-of-h1-b-visa-and-getting-job-sponsorship-in-the-usa-tickets-20365263050">Click here to Buy Tickets

NOTE: This event provides targeted networking and learning opportunities with very seasoned and successful recruiting, immigration and career development professionals. Meet them in person, form partnerships, and learn how to be strategic and smart in pursuing job sponsorship in the US.

*Light refreshments will be served*

Early Bird: $15

Discounted Online registration: $20 

Regular Online: $25 

At the door: $30

</a><a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/h1b-jobseeker-roundtable-complete-understanding-of-h1-b-visa-and-getting-job-sponsorship-in-the-usa-tickets-20365263050">Click here to Buy Tickets 

*Note: we expect this event to sell out prior to Jan 27th, so please purchase your ticket now to ensure your seat.

 Featured Panelists:

Deborah J. Notkin

Ms. Notkin is a partner in the firm of Barst Mukamal & Kleiner LLP and maintains a large business immigration and nationality practice. She is a past president of the American Immigration Lawyers Association (AILA),[masked] and serves on its Board of Governors.

A noted expert in immigration she is a frequent lecturer at the Practicing Law Institute, the New York State Bar Association and AILA. Human Resource Magazine has named Ms. Notkin one of the 15 most powerful business immigration attorneys in the U.S.

Ms. Notkin is listed in Best Lawyers in America; the International Who is Who of Corporate Immigration Lawyers, and Chambers USA as recommended immigration counsel. New York Super Lawyers has listed her as one of the top immigration attorneys in New York. Her numerous articles on business immigration have been cited frequently in other articles on immigration.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/deborah-notkin-62070632 

Jordan Haberfield

With a 25+ year career aligning Talent Management and Recruiting strategies with tangible business value across multiple industries/fields (finance, technology, pharmaceuticals, marketing, etc), Jordan has been successful in helping companies implement successful initiatives in Recruitment Strategy Development, Full Life-Cycle Recruiting Process Design and Improvements, Retained and Contingent Search and Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Integrations.

After co-founding and building one of the first and most influential technology staffing, executive search and consulting firms focused in the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) space, Jordan spent 10 years working with other fast-growing technology and management consulting firms advising CXO clients on recruiting, lead generation and talent management strategies. 

Leveraging his experience working with executives and senior technologists, Jordan now help clients find and attract the key resources they need to succeed and grow.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/jordanhaberfield

                                             Moderator: 

Vicki Aubin

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') helps career revolutionaries to unleash their inner rockstar and reinvent themselves. A career transition and personal branding specialist, Vicki helps her clients to crank up the volume on their most marketable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. 

With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, over a decade in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche and Morgan Stanley), and as a successful career transitioner herself, Vicki has been a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series and a mock interviewer for several educational institutions including the NYU Stern School of Business, Rutgers University and The Flatiron School.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com or on Twitter at @rockincareer.

group.name: Mini Adventures For Free - Hiking, Dancing, Sports & More

results.description:
**MUST RSVP | CLICK HERE TO ATTEND**

Are you trying to break into Product Management, or looking to stay ontop of your Product Management game? Come hear some good insights on how to be a successful PM in NYC from veteran NYC PMs. We'll also cover how to grow your career once you're a product manager. Our panel of PM experts will share advice and answer questions.

We plan to have an interactive discussion and will be crowdsourcing and answering questions from the audience in real time.

Timeline:

6:30 - 6:45 pm - Meet & Greet
6:45 - 7:45 pm - Panel Discussion
7:45 - 8:30 pm - Networking
*wine & refreshments will be provided

Takeaways:

Understand the role and importance of product managers in today's tech industry.

Get tactical tips from successful product managers on how to transition to product management and grow your career

Meet the Panelists:

Chris Kurdziel managed new product development for Samsung’s NYC R&D lab where he worked with internal product leaders and external content partners to re-imagine Samsung’s TV platform and SDKs. Chris studied computer science at Vanderbilt and received his MBA from Cornell University. Chris is a native New Yorker, has lived in 6 states and been to all 50. When he's not building stuff you can find him with a guitar or camera in his hands or playing a game of DOTA2.

</a>

<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/sophiahhuang">Sophia Huang is a Product Manager at CheapOair, Lead Instructor at Product School, and Scrum Master with 9 years of experience of cross-functional leadership in digital and mobile production, agile/lean development, roadmap strategy, and multi-million business building, from both agency and client-side. 

Ben Horst is a product manager for Bloomberg LP, where he is engaged in bringing a new user-centric UX focus to its key partner portal. Ben has worked in digital product management for close to 15 years, at a wide range of scales—from startups to global enterprise. He an exstensive web and mobile product portfolio.

About our Co-hosts:

Product School offers product management courses in San Francisco, Silicon Valley and New York.

Grind isn’t an office, it’s the antidote to offices. A members-only shared workspace and coworking community dedicated to taking all of the frustrations of working the old way and pulverizing them to a dust so fine it actually oils the wheels of the machine.
results.name: How to Become a Successful PM in the Big Apple - Speaker Panel

results.description:
Everyone must RSVP on Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/e/2016-highlights-for-entrepreneurs-tickets-20906766702

We will go in depth into the new media platforms of live streaming with speaker, Vin Nolan, of Periscope.

In the world of entrepreneurship one of the most important things is being able to adapt to the times. 2016 is a new year with important major trends and changes we can expect with new trends in marketing, funding, and new industries. The event will be divided into three major parts

1. Funding and Regulation for Startups- the focus will be about SEC Title 3 Crowdfunding regulations, which are going to allow for the creation of equity crowdfunding platforms. Speaker is Liberty McAteer

2. Social Media and Marketing- this will identify the growth and popularity of live streaming platforms like Periscope and Meerkat for marketing. Speaker is Vin Nolan a Periscope influencer and headliner at the Periscope Summit. 3. New Industries- This will be a discussion about how the release of Oculus, HTC Vive, and Playstation VR will create a new VR industry in the same capacity like the iPhone release in 2007 created a new eco-system for startups in mobile. While also understanding how it can be a disruptive force in already established industries. We will also dedicate a portion of time at the event for networking.
results.name: Adapting to 2016

East Coast REIA is wishing you and your family a very happy holiday season!

Kevin Clark, Managing Member

Clark Capital Group, LLC

"How to Use Hard Money to Finance your Real Estate Projects"

results.description:
We are thrilled to host a Coder Career Series every other Wednesday at Byte Academy. The events will help attendees brush up on programming on-the-job or land that perfect job. Regulars range from people who recently learned how to code, to developers at the New York area's top technology companies. Cracking the Coding Interview (5th or 6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell will be followed. Although the event will break individuals into groups to discuss the topics of choice, this session’s focus is Chapter 14. Chapters are non-cumulative, and coders of all different skills and languages are welcome.


The series will run every other Wednesday and is a joint event with the Fin-Tech Meetup, http://www.meetup.com/Byte-Academy-Finance-and-Technology-community/.

About Byte Academy: Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)
results.name: Algorithms and Interview Prep at Byte Academy

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
Dear 350NYC Members and Friends,

We are excited to kick off this year's meeting schedule with a great event and we hope you will join us. 2016 is already shaping up to be a big year for climate activists so let's start on a high note.


Wednesday January 27th from 7-9pm

NEW MEMBERS:  If you're new to 350NYC please join us at  6:30pm  for a brief orientation to the group, learn about our working groups and some of the campaigns we are currently involved with.


AGENDA

1. For the first hour we will hear from two speakers who were both in Paris for the COP21 Climate Negotiations.  They will help us review what was accomplished and what was lacking, from their particular perspectives. 


What lessons were learned? How do we use what was accomplished in Paris to help us leverage change in NYC and New York State? 

-> Clara Vondrich, Global Director of Divest-Invest Philanthropy
-> Kevin Murungi, Global Kids, Director of Human Rights and Foreign Policy

2. For the second hour we'll be engaging everyone in preliminary planning for the upcoming global escalation to break free from fossil fuels: May 2016 - Break Free   http://breakfree2016.org/


Join a global wave of resistance to keep coal, oil + gas in the ground. We have a few months to make this a major event in the New York region and we will be engaging in a series of build-up actions in preparation.  We have a lot of flexibility in what we do so ...  ... now is the time to bring your ideas and energy to help shape the future.

3. We'll share some exciting opportunities for local action to support activists fighting to stop fossil fuel infrastructure.

Looking forward to seeing you next week.

The 350NYC Team

[masked]

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
After a number of successful meetups, Wall Street Share is hosting another gathering in its offices for promising private companies seeking to build new relationships and/or attain access to investors and strategic partners.  Since our inception late last year, Wall Street Share has selected 8 companies to move into its space.  We have provided such companies with many resources and access to critical relationships that they otherwise may have been unable to attain, and we have even invested our own capital in some of the endeavors in our space.

The primary purpose of our meetups is to gather new promising companies, share ideas, help connect them with others to explore synergies, and potentially provide them with valuable resources and relationships to help them get to the next level.  Anyone is welcome to attend, so don’t feel intimidated.  It’s a very casual and intimate setting comprising entrepreneurs and companies at a wide gamut of stages in which we have stimulating discussions.

If you would like to learn more about Wall Street Share or apply for a membership, please see our website at www.wallstreetshare.com.  We look forward to seeing you next week!
results.name: Meetup for Promising Companies Seeking Resources, Relationships or Investors

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, January 6th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The January session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (January 5th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

results.description:
Join us in our first NY-Israel Fash&Tech event. 

Meet the community, network and get ready to be inspired!

Agenda:

7:00pm- Gathering and networking

7:20- Opening remarks

7:30- Wishi's Story- Best Practices in Building Your own Fashtech Startup

A presentation followed by Q&A with Clea O'Hana, Co-Founder of Wishi (Wear It, Share It).

O'hana will speak about Wishi's success story including all the possible mistakes that occurred during the way, which lessons were learned and what's next for Wishi.

Wishi is a recently launched digital market network that allows fashion customers to access personal styling via an innovative crowd-source platform. It is the ultimate social styling network, created from users personal closets and online finds, enabling the community to create and share looks and provide styling advice. 

WiShi is VC backed (JVP, VENREX, LEPE partners) as well as top fashion industry leaders ( Maurice Marciano, GUESS inc.) . Released early this year in beta form, WiShi is getting a lot of traction with a 45% month over month growth rate. 

Clea O’Hana began her career in styling at Net-A-Porter, where the idea for an online crowd-sourced styling initiated, and further honed her styling skills in the VIP department at Belstaff.  Her co-founder is Lia Kislev.

8:15- Networking 

Looking forward to a fun and interesting event!

See you :)

Liraz

results.description:
It’s crazy… 33% of couples in a marriage or serious relationship have found love online; and, yet online dating remains an under utilized mystery, that almost 40% of adults use often times hopelessly!

To start this Year 2016 on the right foot, we thought you’d love a workshop that will give you a keen understanding and how-to takeaways to better experience the use of dating sites and apps.

You’ll get 2 hours and 2 expert perspectives on dating and online dating… with love consultants Natalia De Oliveira, and Jennifer Castaneda.

They’ll teach you how to use efficiently and intuitively dating sites and better interact with your potential dates.

You’ll learn about:

-  The Dos and Donts of online dating

-  Optimizing your profile description, headline, photos to attract more quality potential dates

-  Choosing the site or app that’s right for you and your needs

-  Achieving a successful dating search

-  Icebreakers and conversation starters

-  Transferring from virtuality to reality

After their presentation, you’ll get a chance to go on mini-sessions with the coaches, ask questions privately and share your experiences.

A little note about Natalia

Natalia De Oliveira

Dating Coach

Natalia is a seasoned Psychotherapist turned Dating and Relationship Coach. Natalia’s objective through TheRelationshipCoach, LLC is to empower adults in the love department and help them find compatible matches. Natalia provides a range of personal relationship services, including: in-person or virtual coaching sessions, online dating profile assistance, real-time advice via text, and even being your wingman for a happy hour. You can rely on her to provide objectivity, advice that is logically and emotionally balanced, and empowerment to ask for more from your relationships.

With both a BA and an MA in Psychology, she takes an evolutionary psychology and physical anthropology based standpoint when studying romantic love and mating behaviors.

You can learn more about her at www.nycrelationshipcoach.com

Follow her on twitter @NYCTRC or Instagram Natid27

A little note about Jennifer

Jennifer Castaneda

Dating Coach

Jennifer has a Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing from Rutgers University and is trained as a Certified Clinical Hypnotherapist by the Motivational Institute of Hypnotherapy.

Jennifer always knew she would be working to help heal hearts. Prior to working as a Dating Coach, Jennifer worked on the cardiology department at St. Joseph’s Medical Center until 2012 and she went on to teach nursing students.

Jennifer joined AVConnexions as a Dating Coach. She is best known for using techniques such as hypnosis, thought reframing, energy shifting and love opening 7-step system to help singles trust their decisions, let go of their past, feel genuinely complete and experience amazing love.

Jennifer is a member of B.I.G. (Believe Inspire Grow), a dynamic networking group in New York City.  The national organization helps broaden the resources and relationships of women who desire growth in both their personal and professional lives.

She is the primary dating coach expert for the organizations Latinas in Business, and New York Dating Life.  As well as a featured guest writer for Sisters of Serenity & Sobriety. Jennifer has also been featured in Thought Catalog and allnurses.com.

Follow her on periscope for empowerment tools and techniques in in and in life. @manifestlovenow

Instagram manifestlovenow  www.avconnexions.com

results.description:
As all biblical scholars know, the Bible was written by a number of authors over a long period of time and then edited down into the work with which we are all familiar (more or less; mostly less). 

But now the renowned biblical sleuth and scholar, Dr. Richard Elliott Friedman, a professor at the University of California, San Diego, reveals his most startling and revolutionary discovery: buried within the Bible is a continuous narrative, a 3000-year-old epic of love, deception, war, and redemption, written by a single, masterful author but subsequently sliced apart by ancient editors who interlaced it with other stories, laws and poetry.  

Using a creative blend of scholarship and detective work, Dr. Friedman has joined together this story from the dawn of written history into the extraordinary form in which it was originally written, what he calls “the first prose masterpiece”.

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Great Lectures on DVD: "The Hidden Book in the Bible"

results.description:
Let's get together for conversations and cocktails at Jimmy, 18 stories high atop The James Hotel in Soho.

The New York Times says that Jimmy's interior is "chic minimalism (a quartet of craning Arco lamps, couches around bongo-size tables, scattered modern art)...Outside, the teak deck is a scene-stealer, with the wading pool shimmering beneath a soaring architectural wishbone."

According to Party Earth Review, "Situated eighteen floors above SoHo in the ultra-modern James Hotel, Jimmy is a don’t-miss rooftop hang with a 360-degree city view and a fashionable clientele of successful local artists and creative professionals. Sleek and chic, the space features soaring windows and a busy bar serving premium beers and mixology creations like the Chanel No. 9 and the Night of the Iguana to artsy couples and stylish Ladies’ Night revelers."

UrbanDaddy says about Jimmy, "enclosed in a warm cocoon of glass walls, this is where you will go to conduct your rooftop board meetings this autumn [or winter]. Which is to say you’ll settle in on a cush light blue sofa in front of the life-size photograph of a fireplace, order up a round of Manhattans and let the sweeping views of the good parts of New York into your life for one brief evening."

With all the wonderful vegetarians and vegans who attend each of our events, every event we do is liked by our members, but our "Veg Night Out!" events are the most popular of all. People enjoy the fact they can mingle (speak with lots of different people), and they love the beautiful venues that we go to. Join us for a stellar evening of lively conversation and lovely surroundings with fellow vegetarians and vegans.


There is no cover and no minimum. But please do buy a drink or two, or as many as you like.

For our new members: this is an incredibly friendly and welcoming group. Come to our Veg Night Out! at Jimmy and make new friends.

Our event officially runs from 7:00pm to 9:00pm. I am sure a good number of us will be staying till 10 (or later).

Where to meet: We will be by the seating area located to the left of the bar. Look for our large group. Be sure to go up to the top floor (18th floor) after you enter the hotel.

See you at Jimmy!

Martin

results.description:
El astronauta hispanoamericano de la NASA Michael López-Alegría nos hablará sobre sus experiencias en el espacio, los desafíos tecnológicos y los experimentos científicos que se llevan a cabo. Veremos también multitud de imágenes y vídeos.

Tras la charla habrá una recepción para los asistentes

Please RSVP here

This event will be in Spanish

RESUMEN:

Una visión general de los vuelos espaciales desde sus orígenes en la Unión Soviética a los logros actuales en la Estación Espacial Internacional. Seis décadas de competencia que se convirtieron en cooperación, experimentación científica y los avances tecnológicos que las hicieron posibles. Además de percepciones del pasado y del presente, una mirada actualizada al futuro de los vuelos espaciales tripulados.

BIO:

Michael López-Alegría hizo historia como el primer astronauta nacido en España que viajó al espacio. Durante su carrera en la NASA participó en cuatro misiones espaciales, acumulando 257 días fuera de la Tierra. Además, tiene el récord de paseos espaciales de la NASA, realizando un total de 10 caminatas. López-Alegría ha participado activamente en la construcción de la Estación Espacial Internacional (ISS). Realizó tres misiones en el transbordador espacial, la primera, la STS-73 en 1995 que se centró en experimentos científicos. Tras dos misiones más entregando elementos esenciales para la estructura de la ISS, en 2006 fue nombrado comandante de la misma y realizó su cuarta y última misión (Expedición 14), la más larga alcanzada por cualquier estadounidense. La tripulación de López-Alegría estuvo más de siete meses operando, construyendo y utilizando la estación y sus instalaciones científicas. Desde abril de 2007, fue Director de Operaciones de la tripulación de vuelo en el Centro Johnson de la NASA (Houston). Posteriormente Michael López Alegría ha sido Presidente de la Commercial Spaceflight Federation y actualmente asesora a más de 50 compañías en todo el mundo en nuevas tecnologías. En octubre de 2014, en reconocimiento a su brillante carrera, ha sido galardonado con el Premio Paz de Westfalia.
results.name: NASA astronaut Michael López-Alegría - "Imágenes de una carrera espacial"

results.description:
Join us for a seminar and Q&A session on Leading in Tech with Cornell University Professor Sam Bacharach. Professor Bacharach is a sought after coach, consultant, Inc. columnnist and author well-known for his work with companies like Cisco, SunGard, Mindtree along with many of the Fortune 500, Inc. 5000 and Non-Profits/NGOs. Whether you're building your company from the ground up, or seeking insight on how to bring innovation to your organization, you'll want to hear this talk.

RSVP HERE: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/leading-in-tech-how-to-foster-innovation-and-drive-execution-tickets-18911127692?aff=swiftmeetup


Sam Bacharach is the McKelvey-Grant Professor of Labor Management at Cornell University’s ILR School. He is the Director of ILR’s New York City based Institute for Workplace Studies as well as the Director of the Smithers Institute and the director of the New York City-based Master of Professional Studies. He received his BS in economics from NYU and his MS and Ph.D. from the University of Wisconsin.For the last 10 years, Professor Bacharach has focused on bridging theory and practice. Integrating his earlier work on politics, negotiation, and complex organizations into his studies of the workplace, Sam has established his own unique perspective on proactive leadership. Samis the author and editor of over 100 articles and over 20 books, including his two most influential works, Get Them on Your Side: Win Support, Convert Skeptics, and Get Results (2005) and Keep Them on Your Side: Leading and Managing for Momentum (2006). His work has been reviewed by The New York Times, Fast Company, HR Magazine, CIO Magazine, Investor’s Business Daily, Leadership Excellence, and Harvard Management Update. Working with eCornell, Samuel has developed a dynamic 10-course leadership training certificate for high potentials, subscribed to by many Fortune 500 companies. Among the organizations trained in his pragmatic leadership approach are: Computer Sciences Corporation, PepsiAmericas, Starwood Hotels & Resorts, March of Dimes, Wal-Mart Stores, Citigroup, International Monetary Fund, Mellon Financial, Starbucks, BASF, BMC Software, Boeing, Inter-Continental Hotels Group, Chubb, Nintendo, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Devon Energy, TeleTech, and Gap, Inc.
results.name: Leading in Tech with Cornell University Professor, Sam Bacharach

results.description:
Note the later time! 

We'll meet in front of MP Taverna for a loop run along Buckout St to Mercy College, through Dobbs Ferry and back. Afterward, everyone is welcome to stop in at MP Taverna for drinks and/or eats.

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the parking lot in front of MP Taverna. We'll head south on Buckout St and Half Moon Lane and then we'll use the little wooded short cut to the Ardsley Train Station. We'll run past the station, veer right onto the lit walking path into the Mercy College campus, and through the campus, exiting on to Broadway at Landing Dr. We'll head south on Broadway and then we'll weave through Ardsley Park, taking Langdon to Belmont to Field Terrace to Osceola, before exiting right onto Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: MP Taverna parking lot (One Bridge St, Irvington, NY)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Dobbs Ferry Loop

results.description:
The format of course stays the same: 5 minutes to show off your hack, and 5 minutes for the audience to applaud, cry, laugh, inquiry, snore, chew, stand, sit, dance, grow, interact, etc. But, of course, we hope that the audience provides lots of great feedback and asks interesting questions (probably while sitting, though dancing audience members are certainly free to participate as well)!


Show us what you've got! But, remember, no startup pitches, no work related projects[0], and no deckware! See you at Meetup!

If you're interested in presenting, this is the url to use:

•  http://j.mp/PresentAtRound36


NOTE: All money raised from the $5 RSVP fee will of course be donated to an organization in need. (Last time we donated it to the Software Freedom Conservancy! https://sfconservancy.org/)

[0]: Let us clarify the "no job projects" rule. We want to promote the projects that people do in their spare time, for fun, or utility, and not the kinds of projects that are only applicable to people who work in your company, or your direct clients. On the other hand, there may be a project that you've built primarily at work, that solves a *general* problem that your company has allowed you to release with a libre license-- this is usually fine.


Questions We Expect To Be Asked

Do I have to pay if I sign up to present?

* No! Anyone who even so much as submits a presentation proposal, whether or not you're actually selected, will *not* be charged. If you want to present, you already have "skin in the game." We're trying to make everyone who wants to attend invested enough to *actually* show up.

I have a fixed income / am a student / just simply don't have $5 to spare, can I still come?

* Please contact [masked], let us know, and we'll take care of you! We definitely want to be as inclusive as possible, and if money is your only problem we won't let it get in the way of you joining us!
results.name: Round 36: A square triangle

results.description:
As all biblical scholars know, the Bible was written by a number of authors over a long period of time and then edited down into the work with which we are all familiar (more or less; mostly less). 

But now the renowned biblical sleuth and scholar, Dr. Richard Elliott Friedman, a professor at the University of California, San Diego, reveals his most startling and revolutionary discovery: buried within the Bible is a continuous narrative, a 3000-year-old epic of love, deception, war, and redemption, written by a single, masterful author but subsequently sliced apart by ancient editors who interlaced it with other stories, laws and poetry.  

Using a creative blend of scholarship and detective work, Dr. Friedman has joined together this story from the dawn of written history into the extraordinary form in which it was originally written, what he calls “the first prose masterpiece”.

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Great Lectures on DVD: "The Hidden Book in the Bible"

results.description:
The present realities are that many entrepreneurs work on the projects with other parties without officially forming a business entity. The reasons may be different. The prevailing ones are to save costs and/or to wait until they are confident in the viability of the business.  It is important to know how such business relationships are viewed according to the law and what provisions the law imposes on the participating individuals. When there is no formal agreement in writing, the law establishes certain default rules for governing such partnership. Those default rules often do not reflect the best interests of the partners but legally bind them when they have not established their own. However, there may be some equitable defenses to prevent a total windfall to one party if it contradicts with the initial understanding of the parties.

During our meetup we will discuss

·  What is a general partnership?

·  Which circumstances trigger its formation by default? Was there ever a general partnership?

·  Liabilities of Partners to Third Parties

·  Rights & Liabilities Between Partners

·  If there was a general partnership, did that partnership legally end?

·  other relevant matters.
results.name: Possible Legal Issues with a Former Partner and How to Avoid Them

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

From the synopsis: "A young American named Greta (Lauren Cohan) takes a job as a nanny for an 8-year-old boy in a remote English village. To her surprise, Greta learns that the child of her new employers is a life-size doll. They care for the doll as if it was human, which helps the couple to cope with the death of their own son 20 years earlier. When Greta violates a list of strict rules, a series of disturbing and inexplicable events bring her worst fears to life, leading her to believe that the doll is alive."

This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending. Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group. Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday, eleven days prior to the Meetup. On that day, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order, with a link to the Google Drive folder where the stories live. That list will also appear under Discussions and will be edited as changes occur.

To submit, Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam

MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.

Send to [masked]

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!

results.description:
Open Flow

All Levels. Alignment and slow flow. Modifications taught and encouraged. Pleasure and fun, breathing, moving, smiling. This class is designed to start with vinyasa flow to warm up, and include standing poses and core work. For students who feel the urge to move seamlessly from one posture to the next with the grace of a dancer and the mindfulness of a yogi. Poses are held for a moderate length of time to create awareness in the mind and body. Pranayama (breathing techniques) and meditation are introduced.

results.description:
The Muskebeers won again. Yay! We will be back to claim our tab credit and see how long we can keep the title.

Trivia starts at 8pm and is 5 rounds in this format:

1st Half: 6 questions of different categories, each wagered from 1-6 (no repeats) • Handout Round: Past weeks include word scramble on musical instruments, celebrity anagram, and colors on corporate logos. • 2nd Half: 6 questions (likely w/ a common theme), each wagered from 2-12 (on the even numbers, no repeats). This is most likely an audio-based round. Past weeks include music, celebrity audio clips, cartoon theme music. • Current Events: 4 questions, 5 pts each • Final Round: 2 questions, each wagered between 1-12

Parking options include street parking (free after 7pm), lot parking ($1?) and garage parking.

results.description:
Week #3 of our current Beginner Salsa class Cycle is around the corner and the room is 1203.

A better/alternate way to keep up with updates, room changes, tips, videos, and in contact with other students is to join the facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Location: Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Avenue New York, NY 10018

Room: 1203, 12th Floor

Fee: $15 per class

Time: from 8pm-9:30pm.

We will not review the basics again so if you missed the first or second week then you are behind. In order to catch up. You must attend this week's La Fama Social so you can learn the basics in time for the Jan 27th class:

http://www.meetup.com/lafamasalsa/events/228141739/


This week's lesson plan will involve a lot of practice of the basic and the right turn. Last week we learned it, this week we start perfecting it. We will practice with slow tempo music, mid-tempo, and high tempo so please do not wear boots. This is the video we took for you to practice before this week:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DnSzrDr4FyU

What's new? We will learn the left turn and practice it. For partnerwork, we will learn the cross-body-lead/follow. This this a very important move to learn so don't miss it plz.

Here is a partial preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (Jan 13th)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (Jan 20th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (Jan 27th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (Feb 3rd)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (Feb 10th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (Feb 17th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn
results.name: Week #3 - Progressive Beginner Salsa Dancing Class (Wed 27th)

group.name: LA FAMA - Active Salsa Dancing Group - Free Classes

results.description:
Wednesday, January 27, 2016 
8 p.m. to 9 p.m. EST/5 p.m. to 6 p.m. PST


"Through conversations with our community both on social media and in person, we learned that many people feel alone or misunderstood because of their celiac disease. And when 83% of our community remains undiagnosed, it might be easy to think that we’re in it alone.


But, together, we can change this. We can use our energy and our frustrations to speak up and share our experiences and feelings, an important step in not being defined by this disease. 


Last month, Beyond Celiac changed its name from the National Foundation for Celiac Awareness (NFCA). We imagine a future with faster diagnosis, better treatment and a cure for celiac disease. But we can’t do it without you. 


Join Beyond Celiac as we bring together patients and experts to share the realities of living with celiac disease and their hopes and dreams for the future. Together, we are Beyond Celiac."


Register here:

http://www.beyondceliac.org/community/Free-Webinars/Upcoming-Webinars/110/
results.name: Stories Beyond Celiac - Free Webinar

group.name: New York City Celiac Disease Meetup

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

aAt the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 8-10pm ($10)

results.description:
Set at a seaside resort, Gustav (Craig Smith) befriends an impressionable highly successful young artist, Adolph (Josh Tyson). Under Gustav’s relentless questioning Adolph’s fears of infidelity of his novelist wife Tekla (Elise Stone) come ragingly to the forefront. It ultimately becomes clear that the manipulative Gustav is scheming a psychological deadly plot in this fatal sexual--part carnival funhouse--triangle. Described “chilling but surprisingly comedic” Los Angels Times.

Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.” 

Discount tickets for New York Theatre Under $25 Meetup @ $15 each. Use the code “Meet3” when ordering your tickets either by phone at[masked] or online at https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10016145

results.description:
The hobby community never adopted the use of surface mount components that have become the standard in industry and low-cost manufacturing.


Commissioning the manufacture of your own circuit board has become more affordable over the years, so that making a few boards SMD style is cheaper than using through-hole components.

At the next meeting, James will bring his "solder reflow" toaster oven, introduce us to the practice of surface-mount soldering and demonstrate how easy it can be to take advantage of low-cost surface-mount components in your designs.


James was *almost* ready to do some SMD soldering at the last meeting but (I think) was missing some solder paste.

He was able to show us a really "tight" motor-control board he put together.

Jim was trying to install a driver for a "nodeMCU LUA" IoT device. (with built-in WiFi)

It turns out that Jim's board is based on an esp8266 microcontroller which is on a short-list of devices that Ephraim would like to use in his thermocouple temperature monitoring device.  ...And the esp8266 is arduino compatible in some way.

Ephraim plans to bring in an old vintage (tube based) oscilloscope so we can see if it's useful or if it's working. It may be *very* large, so it may not be practical compared to other devices we've got.

Jesse made us think about the differences between successful mass production for "hobby" purposes vs for business purposes, and the issues (some technical, some non-technical) involved in transitioning between the two.

I showed off a (cheap) skateboard that I imagine could be useful for building a radio controlled land-yacht and Jeff took some interest in building something on that platform.

All in all, the last meeting was very productive w/ 12 people in attendance and getting involved.
results.name: Do Surface Mount Soldering (SMD)

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 6:15AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Overview:

Productivity is defined as the state or quality of producing something. Internet-enabled technology makes us more productive. It has also helped usher in new and more engaging waves of distraction. How do we stay focused and be productive with technology that both helps and hinders? 


At this event you will hear from Shelley Golan and Liz Vaknin, co-founders of Our Name is Farm, as they discuss what tools and resources they use to help manage their time and their business. You will also have time to network and build relationships with other entrepreneurs, while enjoying delicious coffee by Seven Grams Caffe and light breakfast food by our hosts.

Agenda 

8:00am-8:10am   Grab your breakfast and coffee

8:10am-8:45am   Interview with Liz and Shelley 

8:45am-9:00am   Questions and networking

About the Venue

Thank you to our partner Wix.com for hosting us at the Wix Lounge. Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence. 

So what are you waiting for? Keep up to date with all the amazing events being hosted at the Wix Lounge.

Sign up for the Wix Lounge Newsletter today!

results.description: We are happy to announce this new addition to the schedule. It is a nice supplement to the longer Sunday night meditation sessions. We will meet every Thursday morning from 8:30-9:00 am at South Mountain Yoga. Jean will lead a partly guided, partly silent meditation. We may do either walking meditation or Jean will select a short reading. No experience is necessary. There is a suggested donation of $10. Please note that due to the short nature of this sitting, we will start on time. Please arrive a few minutes early to get settled an please refrain from wearing fragrances for the comfort of the group. Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

TIME TO SKI AT HUNTER!!

AFTER PARTY FRIDAY NIGHT AT A CABIN CLOSE BY

EAT, DRINK, BE MERRY, & ADVENTUROUS !!!

Come join us .. SKI FRIDAY OR SATURDAY OR BOTH

I am COOKING UP A STORM for FRIDAY night dinner

MAYBE A HOT TUB WILL BE HOT AND READY FOR WHEN WE GET OFF THE SLOPES.

bring your self some gear and a sense of adventure ....and maybe some libations...Ive got the rest covered...

FRIDAY NIGHT DINNER OVERNIGHT ACCOMMODATIONS & SATURDAY BREAKFAST INCLUDED *$40-$50 per person (DEPENDS WHICH HOUSE WE GET AND HOW MANY OF US THERE IS.)

HUNDREDS & HUNDREDS OF ACRES  KAATERSKILL HIKING OUT THE BACK DOOR

PLEASE STATE IN YOUR RSVP IF YOU INTEND TO SKI FRIDAY, SATURDAY  OR BOTH..MEETING PLACE WILL EITHER BE AT HUNTER OR AT THE CABIN DEPENDING

HERES A LINK TO HUNTER

http://www.huntermtn.com/huntermtn/tickets-passes/

RIDES WILL BE ARRANGED ONCE RSVP IS IN...BUS IS ALSO AN OPTION

WE ARE STAYING AT A CATSKILL CABIN..PLEASE BRING OWN TOWEL ,SLEEPING BAG AND PILLOWS.. SINGLE AND DOUBLE BEDS AVAILABLE..NO ROOMS ARE PRIVATE ALL ROOMS ARE SHARED 4-6 PEOPLE EACH.

COST: CHECK HUNTER FOR CURRENT PRICE

PayPal DEPOSIT FOR OVERNIGHT TO RISING TOGETHERLLC     @LIVE.COM and make sure to write it as FRIENDS AND FAMILY

DEPOSIT is $20.00 PER PERSON.. DEPOSIT IS NON REFUNDABLE ... BALANCE FOR HOUSE RENTAL WILL BE DUE THE DAY BEFORE...
results.name: HUNTER SKI/SNOWBOARD W/OPT OVERNIGHT

results.description:
Please indicate if there's any interest to stay over Thursday night and possibly Friday night we have a good deal with a three bedroom house and we will all cook dinner Thursday night and indicate whether would be Thursday night and Friday night or just a one night stay.

I bought 1 ticket; let's carpool up there, great value!

Link to tickets:

https://www.iskiny.com/ski-deals/discover-ny-ski-day  


Discover NY Ski Day January 28th

 Order Tickets Now!!!

https://www.iskiny.com/files/styles/featured_image/public/skiers-west2.jpg?itok=_h1QiddV

You can Discover NY Skiing this January 28th, 2016 with Discover NY Ski Day! You can purchase vouchers starting at $12 each that will entitle you to a lift ticket at participating mountains.

Also if you want to learn to ski or snowboard you can purchase a voucher for that starting at $25!

Purchase up to 8 vouchers for you and your family. Just choose the mountain! These vouchers are good for a day or night lift ticket depending when you go skiing. **

There are NO REFUNDS and Non-Transferable - we do not guarantee weather conditions and there will be no refunds due to illness, weather, conditions.

Purchasing Instructions:
You can order vouchers for both days, January 28th 2016 but only to one mountain per household per day.

You cannot order from multiple mountains on the same day and those will be void if you do. No refunds!

1. Click the BUY NOW link to start your order.

2. Select the product and how many.

3. Enter Guest Names- Tickets are non-transferable, so you'll need to just enter the guest name or simply use Skier 2, Skier 3, etc., if you are unsure who will be skiing with you.

4. Complete your sale by entering in your payment information.

5. Once you've completed the purchase print your confirmation screen, that is your voucher for skiing that day.

Reminder: Save your confirmation emails; you'll need to print your tickets before heading out to the slopes!

Participating ski areas are available by Clicking "BUY NOW" below. Scroll down to the Discover NY Ski Day Items and make your plans today for January 28th!

Any questions please contact the SANY offices at [masked] or[masked]-6550.

NOTE: PLEASE FINISH ONE ORDER BEFORE SHOPPING FOR ANOTHER MOUNTAIN - This will prevent any order confusion.

B U Y     N O W ! ! !
results.name: Ski Belleayre for $12!/Optional overnight & Ski Hunter Friday

results.description:
Hello Friends

Join us, one and all, for our Pitch Deck Teardown! Three start-ups present their pitches to a panel of awesome NY Tech Scene mentors, and get immediate and actionable feedback. Feel free to join us as well, if you're working on your own pitch, or just want to meet great people.

The format:
  • 5 mins pitch
  • 5 min Q&A
  • 5 min panel feedback


Founders Pitching:
Anup Desai (Rentah), Sean Langton (Lokely),Tayo Rockson (UYD Media)


Mentors:
Meng He (Socialsign.in), Lee Moulton (Breather), Brian Scordato (Tacklebox)


Also, we are collecting submissions for those that wanna pitch:

http://bit.ly/1divwEf

Feel free to forward this to your friends that you think may be interested!

Until then, stay cool and classy.. See you Thursday!

Coffee Foundry 

Future events:


2/05 - Owen Davis (Overlap & NYC Seed)
2/12 - Erica Duignan Minnihan (1000 Angels)
2/19 - Tiffany Yu (Diversability)
results.name: PDT: Pitch Deck Teardown

results.description: Witness typewriters in action! Join us in spreading the word about our events and literary journal (RiverRiver.org) at the Nyack Winter Farmers' Market. results.description:
Discover Your Inner Salesperson!
How to develop confidence when selling your product:
January 28
Is one of the resolutions for the growth of your business in 2016 to be more comfortable and confident when talking about your product or service? To sell without being pushy or overbearing? We will be treated to a presentation by Casey Carpenter, a Montclair B.I.G. member who will help us find our "authentic voice" in which to ask for the sale, which will result in more profit for our businesses. The workshop is about "The Magic Words Women can use in their Sales Conversations." The goals are to identify words and phrases that open productive business conversations, and lead to sales, and to raise awareness of the things we do that rob our power. Carpenter promises to "Rev up Your Confidence Using Magic Words to Sell...Even When You're Afraid of Sales!"

Our meeting will be from 10-11:30 at Twin Maples, 214 Springfield Ave. in Summit.
Always free for first-time guests...but didn't you say you were meaning to join B.I.G. in 2016???

You don't need to RSVP to this meetup. This is not the main list for attendees. Summit/NP pod meetings attract between 25-45 smart, supportive, creative, inspiring women EVERY month. If you would like to attend, email [masked] I am happy to add you to the monthly mailing list so that you can learn more about BIG and get into on the meetings.

Also...if you come, plan on staying for lunch following the meeting for some more productive networking!
results.name: B.I.G. Meeting Summit/New Providence on Sales

results.description:
This is an Online Webinar. You Must Register To Participate. 

CLICK ON THIS LINK TO REGISTER  (More instructions can be found at the bottom of this message)

WHEN: January 28, 2016 (4:00 pm - 5:00 pm EUROPE/LONDON)

ORGANIZER & Host: SmartFocus - Jessica Stephens Twitter @SmartFocusWorld

CO-HOST: Forrester Research, inc.- Julie Ask

----------------------------------------------------------

If you make one marketing New Year’s resolution for 2016, it should be to create, enhance or refine your mobile moments strategy. 

With consumers engaging with their mobile devices[masked] each day, that adds up to over 30 billion mobile moments each day in the US alone. Grabbing your customer’s attention in that mobile moment to drive engagement or conversions will be the biggest challenge for marketers in 2016. Those that deliver contextually relevant engagements, personalized for each customer around their location, activity and device, will be the ones who triumph. Marketers need to believe in the new opportunities that can emerge from not only implementing a mobile strategy, but also understanding that mobile moments support and engage customers, throughout their whole customer journey. In an exciting new webinar ‘Mobile New Year’s Resolutions’ experts from SmartFocus and a guest speaker from Forrester Research, Inc. will discuss the challenges and opportunities that face marketers for the future of mobile marketing by covering:

Why attend this webinar:

1. Learn how mobile commerce is now bigger than ever

2. The top 5 mobile resolutions you need to follow in 2016

3. The importance of an automation system to maintain continuous, relevant and contextual engagements

More information about the speakers:

SmartFocus - Jessica Stephens - CMO - Twitter @SmartFocusWorld

Jess brings an invaluable breadth of marketing and leadership experience to SmartFocus. With an unashamedly enthusiastic approach to data, she knows all about the huge impact disruptive technology has in bringing brands closer to their consumers. As the Chief Marketing Officer, Jess is responsible for bringing SmartFocus’ brand to life and telling our unique story globally. Prior to joining SmartFocus, Jess was the Founder and Director at TagPoints and held senior leadership roles at MoneySupermarket Local Deals, Local Daily Deals and Filofax.

Forrester Research, inc. - Julie Ask - VP Principal Analyst - Twitter @JulieAsk

Julie serves eBusiness & Channel Strategy Professionals. Her 25 years of work experience is balanced between the engineering and management consulting work she did in the first half of her career and her work as an analyst for the past 12 years. The combination of technical and business expertise positions prepared her well to work with business leaders to identify new opportunities offered by mobile technology and to develop strategies to engage with consumers on mobile devices. She has worked with hundreds of clients across retail, travel, banking, insurance, CPG, healthcare, and more to advise and guide the development of their mobile strategies. Julie's research and analysis have been widely cited in publications including The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, USA Today, BusinessWeek, RCR Wireless, and The Onion, as well as on CBS, NBC, and PBS.

Mobile ready Recording available,  Slides/PDF available

Added Instructions - How To Register: 

Webinara helps you find webinars for different areas of interest, and notify you when there is a new webinar, within your own areas of interest. 

All webinars provided by Webinara are hosted by companies from around the world using different webinar platforms to provide you the webinar. 

When you click Register for the webinar, you need to be logged in to Webinara to come to registration page. 

If the webinar has 1-click registration, and you are logged in to Webinara, you can click the 1-click registration and you will automatically be registered for the webinar. Check your email for the webinar confirmation email, and click the webinar URL to access the webinar.

If the webinar registration button says Register, you need to be logged into Webinara, and when clicking the Registration button, you will be redirected to the webinar registration page for webinar organizer. Register there to get webinar confirmation email. Check your email for the webinar confirmation email, and click the webinar URL to access the webinar

You can login to Webinara or register to Webinara using your email, or just click Sign in with Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn.
results.how_to_find_us: Do not wait for the last minute to Register, or it is likely you will not get a space. It takes just a few minutes to register now.
results.name: Get your Mobile Marketing in Shape for 2016 - Forrester Research, inc.

results.description:
Have you been thinking about making a change to do more impactful work? Are you always the one giving advice to your friends? Are you interested in the field of coaching as a possible career?

Come join me for a casual Meetup this Thursday afternoon where I'll tell you all about the life I have built coaching people in the areas of relationships, desire, and purpose. It's invigorating and rewarding work and there's a whole world out there who needs it!

I spent 8 years in the tech and consulting fields before making the jump to coaching. I'll tell you all about how I made the switch, what it's like to coach people, and how you can get started on a path like this.


For more info contact me, Chris, at (415)[masked] or

[masked]
results.name: Learn About a Career as a Relationship Coach!

results.description:
How to Light and Shoot Great Interviews; Anywhere/Anytime

The interview is a staple in documentary, corporate and ENG filmmaking, and bread and butter for many filmmakers. While each interview presents it's own set of challenges, there are three common types of interviews every shooter should master.

Join Daniel Norton On Set for this full day of hands-on demos. We will explore camera, lighting and audio for sit down interviews, run and gun interviews, and magazine show style interviews.

Learn: How to light simply, quickly and effectively.

Learn: How to use 4K to create an "extra" camera.

Learn: How to record great audio in every location.

Learn: What questions to ask your producer before you step on set.

There will be three 60-90 minute sessions 12:00pm, 2:00pm and 4:00pm Each session will cover a different type of interview from start to finish

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/DanielNorton_HEAD.jpg?itok=_Trb87cX Daniel Norton is a photographer, director and DP with over 15 years experience in the advertising and editorial markets. As Senior Lighting Consultant and Trainer for Adorama Pro, Daniel can help you with any questions you might have about lighting, studio and production. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings every Thursday as well as the AdoramaTV series OnSet with Daniel Norton.

To see more of Daniel's work, go to: dnphoto.com
results.name: FREE Demo! OnSet Day: How to Light and Shoot Great Interviews

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath.

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program. We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program. 

 Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.
results.name: Breathe,Meditate & Rejuvinate
