results.description:
Dear Blogger Babes, 

We’re holding a Twitter Party withYouthH2O, a beauty and health supplement drink. The theme: #WholeBodyReboot, where we will be talking about getting our health and wellness on for this coming year. Joining me (@heidinazarudin) will be health, beauty, and wellness experts @wholebodyreboot, @ethrive, and @staciecoxbeauty.  


Joining a Twitter party is simple (and fun!):


1. Make sure you follow @youthH2O @heidinazarudin, @wholebodyreboot, @ethrive, and @staciecox , and of course @thebloggerbabes on Twitter now.

2. Set your calendar for 1.30 PM EST  on Jan 28th.

3. At the party’s starting date and time, follow the hashtag #WholeBodyReboot and join the conversation. You need to use the hashtag each time you tweet.

Four winners will win a Whole Body Reboot book, a month supply of YouthH2O, and a case of Pichuberry. There are also BLISS 6-pack skin care sets and an Estee Lauder beauty gift set (valued at $150) to be won!


See you then!

Heidi Nazarudin
results.how_to_find_us: #WholeBodyReboot
results.name: Twitter Party With YouthH2O 1.30 PM TODAY

She says that during the movie, you can drop-in anytime and leave there anytime.  She says there were many babies with their caregivers and if your kids start crying, running, etc, no one is bothered!  

It's free and no reservation is required. There is stroller parking space. 

We won't do a formal meet up, since it not a good event for moms to chat but might be good if you're looking for a reason to get out of the house and to the library!

results.description:
This is an online first and offline once selected event.. Please visit: http://dtd.analyticsweek.com for more information.

No long lines, No handshakes, until you're drafted!

AnalyticsWeek's Analytics.Club is bringing biggest data talent draft day to town. On last Thursday of every month top data and analytics talent applicant will be drafted for interview and invited to showcase their data talent in front of cutting edge big data companies. Analytics.Club Data Talent Draft works tirelessly to connect top talent with top recruiting companies.

No awkword lines, no haggling to get heard, no competing with noise, and One easy process to connect top talent with top opportunities.

When: Draft begins every Last Thursday of every month. Starting 6:00pm

Where: In your own city. 

Process: 

For Talent 

1. Applicant apply using Job Seeker form till last Thursday of the month

2. Recruiters will get anonymized information and asked to pick drafts by following week

3. Chosen draft candidates will be contacted in 3 following weeks for an interview

If you're DRAFTED interewed and will make the cut, we have some awesome swags for you. 

For Recruiter 

1. Recruiter signup using the form below

2. We will share anonymized candidate info and give a week to pick shortlisted candidates

3. Once recruiter shortlist winning profile, we will ask the candidate and send introduction

Draft the Top Picked Talent and share your success with us. 

How can I participate? 

It's simple. If you are a job-seeker, just Register here and fill the form. Be sure to put your best foot forward to make yourself shine while filling the form. That's it. You're done. On Draft Day, if you are lucky you should hear from one of the top companies partnering with us. Don't be discouraged if you don't hear from anyone as the draft will happen last thursday of every month. 

If you are a recruiter, then register here with your requirements and company details.

-> Data Talent Draft Recruiter Signup
results.name: Analytics.CLUB Data Talent Draft

results.description: Sorry for the delay in posting this one but we had to deal with the owner on this one. The next event will be at The Wall St Humidor. This is a huge cigar shop with a bi level lounge. We will be using the membership only lounge downstairs. In order to do so, each person will be charged a $20 fee but this will also take away from the cutting fee. You will be allow to bring your own cigars unless you want  to purchase here. He does has a nice premium selection. Puchasing a cigar will not take away from the $20 fee. We will have a few bottles of spirits on hand. If you decide to drink, you will be chipping in for the bottle. Andy Oh has been helping putting this together and so far has done a great job. By the way, the lounge downstairs is beautiful & a smokers delight. Don't worry we are keeping the cost here as low as possible & this will be cheaper then the other lounges we attend. Other then cigars, do not bring any beverages or food into the venue. As I said, we are dealing directly with the owner on this one, so nothing is written in stone. Any changes & I will immediately post it. I've been here many times & always a pleasure here. If you have any questions, please ask it under this post and I or Andy will respond to it. We are looking forward to a nice turnout here. I hope you will join us.
results.name: One More for January.

As a member of the Board of Trustees of the NY Blood Center, Michael Hodin bears responsibility for the organization's decision to abandon 66 chimps on islands in Liberia with no food and water.

CALL to ACTION! The abandoned chimps need YOU!
Demand NYBC reinstate funding for their abandoned chimps!

➔ ➔ ACTION 1: CALL NYBC BOARD MEMBER
Jennifer Jones Austin [masked]) @ Fed of Protestant Welfare Agencies where she is CEO. Demand NYBC reinstate care for their chimps! Demand they terminate connections with NYBC

venue.name: Mailman School of Public Health, Allan Rosenfield Building, Mailman Auditorium, 8th Floor

results.description:
Join us as we kick-off the Spring 2016 HITLAB Seminar Series with: 

Dr. Michelle Odlum

Assistant Professor, Nursing Informatics, CU

Analysis of Public Perceptions about Ebola to Inform Health Information Messages: Content and Trend Analysis of Tweets

1/28/[masked] pm

Mailman School of Public Health Auditorium, Floor R8

722 W 168th St, New York, NY 10032

**Join us afterwards for Coogans HITLAB Happy Hour! First 25 seminar attendees receive a free drink voucher.**

Michelle L. Odlum is an Assistant Professor in Nursing Informatics at Columbia University School of Nursing.  As a Disparities Researcher, she has more than ten years of experience working on a variety of research, evaluation, and health promotion initiatives in vulnerable populations.  Dr. Odlum’s current work centers on comparative effectiveness and Informatics-based research with a focus on HIV/AIDS prevention and self-management, Health Information Technology (HIT) and recently Ebola.  She is also a recipient of the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation’s-New Connections Junior Investigator award and holds degrees in Nursing, Public Health and Education.
results.how_to_find_us: Photo ID must be presented to security upon entry. Take the elevator 1 floor down to Floor R*. Make an immediate right to find the auditorium.
results.name: HITLAB Seminar Series

results.description:
Misery SummaryTwo-time Emmy Award® winner and Golden Globe Award® winner Bruce Willis makes his Broadway debut alongside three-time Emmy Award® winner Laurie Metcalf this  in Misery,

Two-time Emmy Award® winner and Golden Globe Award® winner Bruce Willis makes his Broadway debut alongside three-time Emmy Award® winner Laurie Metcalf this fall in Misery, the edge-of-your-seat suspense thriller. Following a near fatal car accident, a world-famous novelist finds himself in a strange house being nursed back to health by his doting, self-proclaimed Number One Fan. But as her love for his work turns to dangerous obsession, he realizes he must plot his greatest story yet: how to escape with his life. Adapted for the Broadway stage by two-time Academy Award® winner William Goldman and based on the classic Stephen King novel, Misery plays a strictly limited engagement of 16 weeks only.

Bus Departs from:

Hasbrouck Heights Houlihan’s

5 State Rt 17 Hasbrouck Heights, NJ 07604, Hasbrouck Heights, NJ

Price Includes: Orchestra Seats  , Rt Bus, Parking Tolls and Tips. 

All For ONLY $139.00pp

Payment Info TBA

results.description:
ALL ATTENDEES MUST REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE IN ORDER TO GAIN ACCESS TO THIS EVENT:  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/playcrafting-nyc-winter-expo-global-game-jam-kickoff-tickets-19666143966


100 games. 700 players. 1 night. And pizza. 
Join us for our biggest Expo yet on January 28th at Microsoft! 

Over seventy game developers will be showing off their latest games one-on-one to a crowd of 700 people. For developers, this is a great opportunity to show off their games (finished or unfinished) and get direct feedback from players. For everyone else, it's a unique opportunity to try out the biggest collection of games made in and around NYC all in one place. Each game gets its own booth as players meet the developers and try out their games. Throw pizza into the mix and you get Playcrafting's biggest event! 

This event will also be launching our first-ever Global Game Jam site in the same space with Microsoft all weekend! Details and signup coming soon - stay tuned.

Playcrafting NYC Winter Expo & Global Game Jam Kickoff!

Thursday, January 28th  / 5:30-8:30pm
Microsoft (11 Times Square)
RSVP HERE

Visit Eventbrite for full details on this event and to secure a spot by purchasing a ticket.

Visit us at playcrafting.com for our full list of upcoming education and events!

Seats are limited. 

---

If you'd like to play inside on turf, here's how to book a spot in our 5:30pm game:

(1) Go to our pick-up page at http://www.thepitchbrooklyn.com/new-page/

(2) Scroll down to the bottom of the page and hit the button "Book Your Space Now."

(3) Set up your account (you only have to do this once)

(4) Book a session or more by clicking Buy+


(5) Click on Schedule to reserve the date and time (i.e., Monday, January 18 at 6:30pm) when you'd like to play.

*If you're going to purchase multiple sessions (at a discounted rate) and the package indicates that it is for a specific day and time (e.g., Mondays at 6:30pm), worry not - you can book any day and time with your package of sessions.


** Please do not RSVP on meetup. All bookings (and waiting) will take place on our own site, above. Thanks!

In the bitter cold of a land mired in eternal winter, hunters take the shape of wolves to better kill their prey. They stalk the snow-filled forests on paws of deadly silence. Powerful and swift, these evil shape-changers roam the land at will, murdering those who oppose them and plundering the weak. At the head of this pack paces the great Black Wolf of the wood. Are you clever enough to survive against villains who are stronger, faster, and fiercer than any you have ever encountered? The Black Wolf awaits your answer in the biting cold....

results.description:
Love brazilian music? This workshop is for you!
We'll get to work on classics of bossa-nova, understand the rhythm patterns and learn the finger style technique to master comping and the nuances of brazilian clave.
You'll get familiar with 7th, 9th, 13th, diminish chords.
Nylon string guitar is recommended for this class but you won't get turned away if you bring a steel string guitar.
You must be familiar with open chords and comfortable playing songs and switching chords in time. Barre chord knowledge is a plus but nor required for this workshop.
This is a one hour workshop with the option of performing three songs May 1st at Arlene's Grocery.
First song is "Samba da Benção" , please find the chart uploaded under TABS>MORE>FILES
Obrigada!

Want to try your pitch out? This is your chance to pitch your idea in front of potential investors and others in the crowd. You will network with other like-minded individuals and hear from some of the best in the business on startup technology and business. 

Keynote Speakers:

Alan Brody -  is author of the new book "Are You Fundable," which is dedicated to helping entrepreneurs become more knowledgeable about the funding process for startups. He is founder of the iBreakfast and iEvening series of pitch events.  As executive program director of TECHmarketing, he has created several media events including eTV World and Digital TV/Internet Conference. He has appeared on the Charlie Rose Show, and spoken at many industry conferences.

Michelle Israel -  is a UX, Product, and Graphic Designer with experience in luxury, CPG, and insurance markets. She is currently the Creative Director of Eagerto, a professional liability insurance platform for freelancers. Eagerto helps protect a freelancer's reputation & financial security by covering costs if something goes wrong. As a freelancer herself, Michelle is excited to launch a product that will help solve problems in the self-employed community.


"WeWork is the platform for creators. We provide the space, community and services you need to create your life’s work. To learn more about WeWork's 12 locations in New York City, send an email to[masked] and let them know you were referred by Try Startup Business Pitch event."

Starta Accelerator, launched by VC fund Starta Capital, is happy to announce the first batch of startups with East European R&D roots that are joining the acceleration program for an opportunity to gain traction and raise next round of funding in the United States. These companies were selected from the hundreds of applications. Only the best candidates with groundbreaking frontier technologies, traction in Europe and global product potential have been accepted.

Please join us for a kickoff welcome party to meet the teams and welcome them to New York! We want our teams to do a 3-5 min pitch around 7 pm to introduce themselves. We will have champagne and snacks to make it fun, warm and welcoming:-)

Register at the following link https://www.eventbrite.com/e/starta-accelerator-batch-1-kickoff-night-tickets-20898979410 Feel free to invite and share this event with ppl who might be interested in what Starta Accelerator does or who could potentially be a great mentor/advisor for the startups in its first batch. For the latest updates or to connect to these companies please contact Starta Accelerator via www.startaaccelerator.com

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group! This special event is sponsored by NYI, a proud supporter of the NYC tech community.

***Please have a government issued form of ID with you. ***

***We will be meeting at a new location, the LMHQ Creative Event & Meeting Space in Downtown NYC.***

This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or to just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.

This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone poses a question, so bring questions!

Some topics up for discussion are:

• Install and configuration assistance

• Documentation, standards, and best practices

• Current events/Conventions

• Release testing and bug reporting

• Getting started with languages like Python and LaTeX

• -Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)

We will also have brief (approx. 5-10 minute) lightning talks, so please speak with a coordinator if you're interested in sharing some of your work.

A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

Bring a project, topic, and questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects. Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the building and come to the 20th floor.
results.name: NYLUG Open hacker hours

AIP (in collaboration with Unique Photo) is pleased to announce it's newest program; monthly meetings around the themes of training, socializing and equipment swaps and cleaning. Meetings will be held on the last Thursday of each month. (No meeting in December and November's meeting will be Dec. 2)

Note: Unique Photo will give every registered attendee a token worth $10.00 off the purchase of any merchandise bought at Unique that night or in the future.

         contact info and price.  Tables will be provided allowing

    cameras.

Announcing Monthly Training Meetings And More!

AIP (in collaboration with Unique Photo) is pleased to announce it's newest program; monthly meetings around the themes of training, socializing and equipment swaps and cleaning. Meetings will be held on the last Thursday of each month. (No meeting in December and November's meeting will be Dec. 2)


Note: Unique Photo will give every registered attendee a token worth $10.00 off the purchase of any merchandise bought at Unique that night or in the future.

LIMITED SPACE, SO REGISTER TODAY!

PROGRAM:


o  6:00 – 7:00 PM:  Equipment Swap & Sale (Canon Room)

         contact info and price.  Tables will be provided allowing
         you to display the items that you want to sell to other
         members.  (We will have people to help with the

results.description:
The Art of The Interview: How Persuasion and Influencing Skills Can Secure Offers.

Network with a senior IT Recruiter and technology career coach for JP Morgan as well as your technology colleagues and learn how to effectively identify the most successful ways to approach an interview. We will share an Interview Check List and  in order to maximize your communication efforts. 

If you are happy in your current role, and interested in moving up within your company, the is the place to understand how to improve visibility and recognition levels. If you are unemployed or unhappily employed, this is a forum to understand how to market yourself for future growth without misconceptions about your qualifications and related experience. 

Share hands-on knowledge from the recruiting and career coaching perspective.  Learn how to best represent yourself, the best ways to respond to questions, what the best questions are for you to ask and some of the most effective methods to follow up. 

Knowledge is Power. We look forward to sharing!

results.description:
Hi All

Just so you know THIS PAGE HAS IMAGES,  if you do not see them and you are viewing this page with

1)  the Meetup App - click the "DESCRIPTION TAB"

2) Android - open your browser's settings menu and click ''REQUEST DESKTOP SITE". 

3) Apple IOS - click the "DESKTOP SITE" button at the bottom of the page.

4) Microsoft Windows - buy a new computer

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

I never take myself this seriously :)

UPDATE 1/28/16

Great news!  I will now be easy to spot thanks to the surgical insertion of a number of pins in the crushed proximal phalanx of my left thumb. Simply look for the guy sporting this rather fashionable post-operative fiberglass cast.


Just a little more business...


Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...

Gregory Crewsdon - Cathedral of the Pines

Gagosian Gallery - 522 West 21st Street

Chris Killip - In Flagrante Two

Yossi Milo Gallery - 245 Tenth Avenue


Yongju Kwon, Dongkyu Kim, Woosung Lee - Floating Concrete

Doosan Gallery - 533 W 25th St, # 101

New Prints - 2016/Winter


International Print Center - 508 West 26th Street, 5th Floor

Buster Cleveland, John Evans, Scarlatina Lust - LOISAIDADA

Pavel Zoubok Gallery - 531 West 26th Street


Peter Hujar - Lost Downtown 

Paul Kasmin - 297 Tenth Avenue 



Robert Zakanitch - In the Garden of the Moon


Nancy Hoffman Gallery - 520 West 27th Street


Knowledge Bennett, Matthew Ryan Herget  - Never Said Never 

Joseph Gross - 548 West 28th Street, 2nd Floor


After the openings (around 8 pm) everyone who would like to continue with the group are welcome to join us at a nearby restaurant (location TBD) for refreshments and general merriment.  

See you at the Hop

Todd
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet just inside the Gagosian Gallery, stay till around 6:30, then visit the galleries in the order listed below, so PLEASE PRINT OR SAVE THIS PAGE. Running late? I'll TRY to update our location during the Hop in the comments of this page.
results.name: Hop #97

results.description:
It is very easy to write programs for Android smart phones and tablets using a modern version of BASIC called Mintoris BASIC. In this class you will learn how to obtain the BASIC app and some demos and a printable version of the 80-page manual, create a user interface, read sensors from the Android device like the GPS, accelerometer, light meter, and send the values to a laptop computer via bluetooth. You will also learn how to send commands to and from a bluetooth-equipped arduino. 

What to bring: An Android device with WiFi and Bluetooth. (NOT an iPhone or iPad). A laptop computer 

Cost: $20
results.name: Writing Android apps in BASIC

The Bronx Innovation Lab would like to invite you to our Startup Ideas Team Building Night.

This event is a prequel for MVP Weekend and the Traincube Startup Challenge.

The selected group of Bronx Innovators will receive assistance from us to develop their ideas from concept to actual business solution.


Do you have an app idea you would like to turn into a reality?

Do you have programming skills you’d like to put to good use?

Do you have what it takes to become an entrepreneur?

Put it to the test. Give it your best.

We’re here to help you achieve your goals and make them a reality.


Come to our next Pitch Night and start building your startup today!

Tonight's agenda will be on building your team.

AGENDA

6:00 - 6:10 PM Greetings

6:10 - 6:20 PM Traincube Startup Challenge Announcements

6:20 - 7:30 PM Rapid Team Building

7:30 - 7:45 PM Break

7:45 - 8:15 PM MVP Team Selection 

(Announcements from Ana and Tommy)

8:15 - 8:30 PM Wrap-up

Please be sure to provide your full name when RSVPing so there aren't any issues with the security desk handling attendance.

results.description:
Come and meet our community of local real estate investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location! If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.
results.name: Learn About Our Real Estate Investing Community, Training & Income Opportunity!

group.name: The NYC Real Estate Investors Success Meetup Group

results.description:
Chinese Food, Hebrew Chat. I need an EXACT head count to make a reservation AND I'd like to keep my good name with the management of this restaurant, so you will be required to RSVP AND CONFIRM THAT RSVP as the date approaches.  I will email you a reminder to confirm.   Anyone who does not confirm will be removed from the attendee list. This restaurant gets consistent excellent reviews and they are kosher, all food is Vegan with one or two vegetarian dishes (vegan =all plant-based, no animal products whatsoever; vegetarian= plant based, no meat, but may contain animal products such as egg, honey or milk) and is recommended highly by one of this Hebrew Language meetup's regular attendees. http://www.chinatownvegetarian.com/  

Situated in the heart of Chinatown, Buddha Bodai has been serving magnificent vegetarian meals since its inception in 2004. Buddha Bodai is committed to achieving and maintaining the delicate flavors of China's deep culinary history.

results.description:
Would you like to -

• Become a more confident public speaker?

•Feel more at-ease during business meetings and social occasions?

•Make new friends, in a supportive and encouraging environment?

The friendly people at Pride Toastmasters would love to help you improve your public speaking skills, as you boost your leadership and self confidence skills! We focus on making our guests very welcome. We meet every Thursday from 6:15 p.m. until 7:25 at the LGBT Center, 208 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011. If you arrive early, expect to be warmly greeted and given an overview of what to expect during the fun, informative and engaging meeting! 

By the way, there’s nothing for you to prepare in advance of our meeting, no fee to pay as our guest and no pressure to join.  Please do visit and sample this exciting option for personal and professional growth!

An average of 20 members and guests attend each Pride Toastmasters meeting. Since most aren't members of Meetup, the attendance figures shown here are always much lower.

Please visit our web site at http://www.PrideToastmasters.com
results.how_to_find_us: For Room Assignment Please Check the Room Assignment List in the Lobby

results.description:
Computers:  Our Basic Computer courses are centered around student needs. We offer levels 1 and 2 depending on the class size and skill level. Our teachers combine their computer knowledge and love of teaching to create a classroom environment that caters to all students with a variety of interests and skill levels.

Computers 1 focuses on how to operate a PC, using a mouse, typing, navigating a web browser, creating an e-mail, and changing computer settings.
Computers 2 focuses on using social media, Youtube, sending and receiving pictures, Microsoft Office (excluding Powerpoint), and typing practice.

Computadoras: Nuestros cursos básicos de sistemas de computadora se centran en las necesidades del estudiante. Ofrecemos los niveles 1 y 2 en función del tamaño de la clase y nivel de habilidad. Los profesores combinarán su conocimiento de la computadora y el amor de la enseñanza para crear un ambiente de clase que proporciona a los estudiantes con practica para una variedad de intereses y habilidades.

Computadoras Nivel 1 se centra en las instrucciones basicas para operar una PC - utilizar el ratón, escribir, navegar por un navegador web, la creación de un e-mail, y el cambio de la configuración del equipo.Computadoras 2 se centra en el uso de las redes sociales, You Tube, enviar y recibir imágenes, Microsoft Office (excluyendo PowerPoint), y práctica del teclado.
results.name: Basic Computers/ Computadoras

results.description:
Heyo!

The season is finally underway and we should get to know each other better! Come out for drinks and make some carpool connections!

Agenda:

Meetup, have drinks, make plans to carpool.

Where:

Flannery's Bar on 14th street between 7th and 8th ave. Near the orange, blue and red lines. Cheap drinks, darts, juke box, TVs and great fried chicken across the street.

Updates:

We're headed back up to the mountains this weekend, so RSVP and connect with some carpoolers.  

If you want to post a carpool, comment on the Meetup, message an organizer or check out http://www.shredshare.io/carpools/.

We're still working on resort and other industry partnerships... stay tuned for discounts and other stuffs. It's a slow process but if we can build the community, we can leverage it to gain access to the mountains that we love.

And more happy hours and weekend meet ups to come. 

Some shred for your eyes:

Ski - Candide Thovex and Google Take Mont Blanc 

http://www.powder.com/stories/first-chair-blog/candide-thovex-and-google-take-mont-blanc-global/#7JkMzEgOxotgLOiF.97

</a><a href="http://yobeat.com/2016/01/24/claim-a-short-film-about-snowboarding-in-new-jersey/">http://yobeat.com/2016/01/24/claim-a-short-film-about-snowboarding-in-new-jersey/

Hope to see you soon,

Jason and The Shredshare Team

results.description:
Come to our open house to learn more about our 12-Week Data Science bootcamp. (Apply before Deadline March 14)

You're Invited! Save the date. Come to learn what to expect from our bootcamp and network with our current students and alumni. Our alumni will speak about their experience at NYC DSA, job search, and their current positions. Food and Drinks are provided!

Event starts at 6:30pm!

6:30 pm - 7:00 pm Check in, mingle, enjoy food & drink

7:00 pm - 7:20 pm Admissions Director Janet Kamin presents

7:20 pm - 7:30 pm Brief Q&A

7:30 pm - 8:00 pm Moderated Panel Discussion

8:00 pm - 8:30 pm

Open questions, and chat with instructors, students, and alumni

Learn what is going on in the data science industry, and what it means to be a Data Science student. Check out our alumni's final projects. Get introductions to our upcoming course offerings or have a 1-on-1 chat with our admissions rep to find the right course for you. Learn about the NYC Open Data Group, NYC Data Science Academy and the benefits of becoming a member of the school and meetup!
results.name: NYC Data Science Bootcamp Open House

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating, you won’t be alone!.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.


We all know that men are from Mars and Women are from Venus but does that apply to the species living in New York City???!!!  Why do things seem so different here??!!  Join us for this fun and interactive night where we get to the bottom of what the opposite sex is thinking.  We have reserved the private lounge on the 3rd floor of The  St Pat's Bar and Grill in the heart of midtown for this fun and informative evening.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way it is going to be a great  night out.

Here is how it works..

-Arrive between 6:30-7:30pm for socializing, mixing and mingling.  During that time you will anonymously fill out your most compelling questions, comments and observations about the opposite sex and drop them into a hat.

-When we have filled the hat our moderator will sit everyone down and read off the questions that will be directed to the opposite sex.  Participants are invited to answer, debate, add to and explain with hopefully useful information  for the opposite sex.

This has been an awesome night for us in the past and usually very informative when it comes to finding out what the opposite sex is thinking about dating, relationships, sex, etiquette, behavior, professional advice and more.

There will be $3-$8 drink specials on beer, wine and cocktails.

A full menu is available.

Cost:  Pay $5 at the door

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own.

Dress code: Business casual

Is there food?  Yes St Pat's has an awesome menu.  Get there closer to 6:30pm if you wish to eat.
results.name: The Differences Between Men and Women Great Face Off Forum & Happy Hour

group.name: New York Every Night (and Day) Social Events and Adventures

We all know that men are from Mars and Women are from Venus but does that apply to the species living in New York City???!!!  Why do things seem so different here??!!  Join us for this fun and interactive night where we get to the bottom of what the opposite sex is thinking.  We have reserved the private lounge on the 3rd floor of The  St Pat's Bar and Grill in the heart of midtown for this fun and informative evening.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way it is going to be a great  night out.

Here is how it works..

-Arrive between 6:30-7:30pm for socializing, mixing and mingling.  During that time you will anonymously fill out your most compelling questions, comments and observations about the opposite sex and drop them into a hat.

-When we have filled the hat our moderator will sit everyone down and read off the questions that will be directed to the opposite sex.  Participants are invited to answer, debate, add to and explain with hopefully useful information  for the opposite sex.

This has been an awesome night for us in the past and usually very informative when it comes to finding out what the opposite sex is thinking about dating, relationships, sex, etiquette, behavior, professional advice and more.

There will be $3-$8 drink specials on beer, wine and cocktails.

A full menu is available.

Cost:  Pay $5 at the door

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own.

Dress code: Business casual

Is there food?  Yes St Pat's has an awesome menu.  Get there closer to 6:30pm if you wish to eat.
results.name: The Differences Between Men and Women Great Face Off Forum & Happy Hour

results.description:
For his project NEW POTT, Mischa Kuball transformed the homes of the 100 people he interviewed into a public stage where immigrants and their families provide glimpses into their lives and the experiences of different generations of immigrants. The multitude of histories and intimate moments that Kuball captured testify to the multiethnic melting pot that the Ruhr represents.

Through its participatory nature, Kuball’s work engages important questions about authorship, the relationship between art and public space, and the ways in which a work of art can accommodate experiences that emerge from different cultural backgrounds. Those questions also lie at the heart of Hans HS Winkler’s works. His Walking Newspaper project, for example, invites audience members to become participants in the artwork and reflect on their political and surroundings and their own social background. 

To what extent can art develop practices that enable people to intervene in public space? By creating new opportunities for participation and authorship, how does art open up new forms of representation that are not tethered to conventional institutions? 

Artists Mischa Kuball and Hans HS Winkler will address these questions in a conversation that will conclude the exhibition NEW POTT at the German Consulate General New York. Both artists will be joined by Dr. Friederike Wappler, Director of the Art Collections of the Ruhr University Bochum, and Peter Rosenbaum, Director of the University Alliance Ruhr office in New York.
results.name: Artist's talk with Mischa Kuball and Hans HS Winkler

Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost. Meetings occur on the second Wednesday and fourth Thursday of the month unless otherwise noted. Please see the Meetup page and calendar for the full schedule.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" by Thich Nhat Hanh***

In "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings", renowned Vietnamese Buddhist monk, teacher, poet, and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) presents the essentials of Buddhist teachings in a clear, compassionate, and concise manner. In addition to covering teachings at the core of all Buddhist traditions, Thay also covers many key Mahayana Buddhist teachings. In all discussions, Thay helps guide us to the heart of what the Buddha taught; the transformation of suffering into peace, joy, and liberation.

First released in 1999, "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" has become a classic and essential read for anyone interested in learning more about basic Buddhist teachings. The book is widely available in bookstores and libraries in print, ebook form, and audio book form.


For the Jan 28th meeting, please read Chapters 16 and 17

Discussion points include:

-What is Right Livelihood?


-What are the Two Truths and how do they relate to other basic Buddhist teachings?


***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle

results.description:
Peter Gray, Evolutionary Psychologist and author of 'Free To Learn" is coming to NYC Thursday January 28.  This event is organized by Agile Learning Center-NYC and will be hosted at Spotify HQ!

Tickets are available now via eventbrite for less than $12!


https://www.eventbrite.com/e/education-evolved-peter-gray-on-self-directed-education-tickets-20098318612

Education Evolved: The Educative Instincts and the Conditions that Optimize Their Effectiveness.

Evolutionary Psychologist, Peter Gray will speak about how children's natural curiosity, playfulness, sociability, and willfulness have all been shaped by natural selection to serve the function of education. Drawing from his research of hunter-gatherer societies, he will present evidence that these instincts still work beautifully in our culture today, if we provide the right conditions.

More about Peter Gray:

Peter Gray, Ph.D., research professor at Boston College, is author of Free to Learn (Basic Books, 2013) and Psychology (Worth Publishers, a college textbook now in its 7th edition). He has conducted and published research in comparative, evolutionary, developmental, and educational psychology.

He did his undergraduate study at Columbia University and earned a Ph.D. in biological sciences at Rockefeller University. His current research and writing focus primarily on children's natural ways of learning and the life-long value of play.

External Links:

http://agilelearningcenters.org/
http://alternativestoschool.com/
results.name: Educative Instincts and the Conditions that Optimize Their Effectiveness.

-Arrive between 6:30-7:30pm for socializing, mixing and mingling.  During that time you will anonymously fill out your most compelling questions, comments and observations about the opposite sex and drop them into a hat.

-When we have filled the hat our moderator will sit everyone down and read off the questions that will be directed to the opposite sex.  Participants are invited to answer, debate, add to and explain with hopefully useful information  for the opposite sex.

This has been an awesome night for us in the past and usually very informative when it comes to finding out what the opposite sex is thinking about dating, relationships, sex, etiquette, behavior, professional advice and more.

There will be $5 drink specials on beer, wine and cocktails until 8pm.

A full menu is available.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own.

Dress code: Business casual

Is there food?  Yes St Pat's has an awesome menu.  Get there closer to 6:30pm if you wish to eat.

results.description:
In 2012, design startup FiftyThree launched its first digital product, Paper, on iPad. Since then, Paper has been downloaded over 14 Million times, and is recognized by industry leaders across the board from IDSA to Apple, and is currently featured in the App Store Best of 2015 . Design enthusiasts and pros loved Paper on iPad, and demanded the app for iPhone.


In rethinking Paper for a smaller device, the FiftyThree design team relied on rigorous prototyping, user testing, and continuous reiterating that continues today.

In this talk by FiftyThree’s Andrew Allen and Amit Pitaru, you’ll gain insight to how a small team planned, prototyped, and challenged assumptions to reimagine a beloved iPad app for an entirely different set of mobile users.

Presenters from FiftyThree

Andrew Allen, Co-Founder & Head of Design
@asallen / fiftythree.com

Amit Pitaru, Head of Prototyping  
@pitaru / pitaru.com

About FiftyThree:
FiftyThree is the maker of Paper, the popular iPhone and iPad app that lets you quickly capture ideas as sketches, notes, photos, or diagrams, and Pencil, the award-winning Bluetooth stylus. Internationally recognized for design excellence and innovation, FiftyThree has received awards from Apple, IDSA, Communication Arts, The Edison Awards, and IxDA. Founded in 2011, FiftyThree is based in New York and Seattle, and brings together the craft of software, hardware, and service design. Learn more on fiftythree.com and @fiftythree.

About Our Sponsor:
Lifion, by ADP, invites you to visit our new home for big ideas, ambitious folks, and those who are truly committed to delivering finely made products at scale. Join us after-hours for provocative talks, engaging discussions and some great opportunities to connect with serious thinkers and doers. Visit us at www.lifion.com for a calendar of upcoming events and current job opportunities. We look forward to meeting you soon!
results.name: From iPad to iPhone: How FiftyThree reimagined Paper for a broader audience

THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR POLITICAL PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY.  Our gathering is first and foremost a Happy Hour for people to come together and socialize.  Secondly, it is a great way for everyone to keep tabs on all the current candidates and thirdly a great way to see the debate if you don't have access to the channel it is on that night!!   Arrive at 6:30pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors. This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

- Discounted price for New Students : $90 for 2 Month Unlimited

CLASSES LOCATION :

500 8th avenue (between 35th /36th street)
New York, NY, 10001

INFO & REGISTRATION:


PIEL CANELA
New York center for latin arts
http://www.pielcaneladancers.com/
212-924-6160 
[masked]
http://onlinestore.pielcaneladancers.com/

David Campos
[masked]
(646)[masked]
www.davidcampos.fr

http://youtu.be/G5Yi2Ar7z5k


<a>https://www.facebook.com/dcamposkizomba
https://www.facebook.com/DavidCamposKizomba
https://www.facebook.com/groups/dance2heartbeatnyc/</a>;

VIDEO LINK : http://www.youtube.com/user/sbsdancefusion/videos?shelf_id=1&view=0&sort=p

What is Kizomba – The Origin

Kizomba is a breath whose rhythm is a beating heart, and where the perfect connection between two dancers gives birth to harmony, exaltation of senses and sensuality" D. Campos

Kizomba (a word meaning "Party" in angola ) takes its origin from the Angolan dance Semba, which is also the origin of the Brazilian Samba.
It appeared at the end of 70’s – 80’s, while the young Angolans, although very attached to their traditional dance,sought a new musical identity, and finally found their inspiration and new voice at a concert given by Kassav, a famous French Caribbean Zouk band. Kizomba was born out of this new generation’s desire to bring a touch of sensuality and sweetness to their national Semba.
The influence of the Angolan Kizomba soon spread to all the African Lusophone countries such as Guinea Bisau, Cape Verde, Mozambique. From there the dance quickly found its ticket to Europe via Portugal, where it further developed, by all these Artists, teachers, choregraphers coming from these Luso-African countries.
As it rapidly gained popularity, Portugal exported Kizomba to various countries in Europe such as France, Spain, Poland, Belgium, Danemark and England. 
Today it is rare to find a Latin dance party without Kizomba represented, as well as salsa or bachata.
This "African Tango Zouk", also called "Tango Lusophone" continues to conquer a growing audience of passionate dancers, eager for beauty of gesture and sensuality, but also the indispensable complexity of exchange and trust present in each motions of Kizomba.
This young dance of barely thirty years is booming today, and constantly evolving.
"Kizomba is a tribute to sensuality, an ode to love and sharing. A moment when the woman's beauty, enhanced by her partner, must embody all its essence. " D. Campos
Be the pioneers here in the U.S. of a dance that will become soon a must for your dancing nightlife !!

Would you like to meet a group of local successful Real Estate investors who are reaping all the benefits of a once in a lifetime buyers market?

At this meeting we will discuss why there are more millionaires created through real estate than all other industries combined. Right now we're in a once in a lifetime Real Estate buyers market which is helping to fuel our expansion. The combination of record low mortgage rates and underpriced housing values is why our group is making a killing in this market. Even the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to buy real estate.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address. 

You will have the opportunity to:

• Network with a local group of successful Real Estate Investors.

• Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax saving strategies out there. 

• Discuss the biggest money making opportunities in today's market: Short Sales, Lease Options, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures, Seller Financed Notes, and Multi-Family Dwellings.

• Learn how to be your own boss. 

• Learn how to build massive wealth strategies such as Fix and Flips and passive wealth with Rental Properties.

• And so much more

We will show you a few deals we've completed recently & explain how you can be included in the deals we have going forward. We will also show you how can become part of our network and be coached and mentored by seasoned real estate mentors so you can complete deals of your own. Each meeting is different as we discuss different deals we've closed.

Some of our members invest part time for residual income while others have been able to FIRE THEIR BOSS to invest full time. If you are interested in learning how to make consistent $10,000 or more per month please register for this event. We have a wide network of Real Estate Investors local to the NY Metro Area that will show you how.

Being that seating is limited please answer the RSVP questions and provide your full name, phone number and email address.

results.description:
I imagine a group I can share tools (patterns, palettes), discuss techniques, and suggest themes, maybe. But what are our goals?


How often should we meet?

On which format? A round of critique? Themes?

Open, closed membership? (a quick look at the portfolio and intentions, yay or nay vote, etc)

Public or private results? Maybe a hashtag?

Discussion of personal goals: any patterns here? Join forces?

Personally, I want to turn from realistic illustrations to character design, something pictoplasma-esque. Which means more attention to colors and concept. 

Also, some ways to turn to SVG, vector, so I can manipulate my creations via CSS. But it's a rabbit hole down there and I don't wanna do it alone.
results.name: Group Goals

results.description:
Please use your full name for RSVP! Security will need both your first and last name to attend this event. 


Speaker: Fiona Charles
Topic: What's My Context workshop


Testers talk about context and many of us identify ourselves as driven by context. But do we really understand what “context” means? Let’s get together and find out!

In this interactive workshop, we’ll use group exercises to explore the idea of context and some practical means for helping to discover it:

• Dimensions and attributes of context (as many as we can think of)

• How elements of context are manifested

• Heuristics for discovering and evaluating context

• elements of it that may be essential

• others that could be peripheral

A final debrief will give participants the opportunity to consolidate and share their insights and experiences. 

Fiona Charles teaches organizations to manage their software testing risk, and IT practitioners project skills “beyond process”—hands-on practical skills essential to thrive and excel on any kind of software project. An expert test consultant and manager, she has been immersed in the action through 30+ years of challenging projects across the business spectrum on both sides of the Atlantic. Throughout her career, Fiona has advocated, designed, implemented and taught pragmatic and humane practices to deliver software worth having. Fiona’s articles and blog posts appear frequently, and she conducts experiential workshops at international conferences, and in-house for clients. She is the co-founder (with Anne-Marie Charrett), of Speak Easy, a volunteer organization whose goal is to increase gender diversity and help new speakers find their voices at tech conferences. Contact Fiona via her website www.quality-intelligence.com, and follow her on twitter @FionaCCharles.

Agenda 

6:30 - Refreshments
6:50 - Welcome and Announcements 
7:00 - Fiona Charles 
9:00 - Networking/Testing Topics "Lean Coffee" Style
9:30 - Event Ends
results.name: January NYC Testers meetup w/ Fiona Charles

results.description:
Let's kick off the new year right! Meet those fitness goals and meet new men and new friends too! The studio, Yoga to the People, is donation based, so pay as little or as much as you want!

1. Show up at 6:30 pm. The restaurant we will be meeting at is called V Spot. It is in the same building as Yoga to the People on 12 St. Mark's Place. Ask the host where the Yoga Social is and they will direct you. Introduce yourselves and don't be shy, we'll likely be at the bar! We'll take a headcount and ask the restaurant to reserve a table for us after class so we can all have a healthy snack to eat or hydrate with organic juices afterwards.

2: We will head upstairs to the yoga studio at 7:00 pm. Please take into account that this is a donation based studio. With that being said, the class can get crowded, so we will go and get the best spots on the floor thirty minutes before class starts. Class begins promptly at 7:30 pm. The studio locks the doors and turns off the buzzer at 7:30 on the dot.

3 After everyone's relaxed and worked out, you're more likely to throw away your defense mechanisms and social barriers, so get to know each other, and socialize! We will congregate at the restaurant below after class until 9:30! 

About the studio:

"Yoga to the People is a unique yoga studio with the goal of recapturing what we consider to be the essence of yoga… simply put, yoga made available to everyone. In a time where yoga as a business is getting a lot of attention, the fact that it is being priced out of many people’s reach is in direct conflict with what we consider to be the spirit of yoga itself."

Note: We are going at a peak time and the studio will be a little crowded, but it is a beautiful space that offers an amazing class, and it's hard to argue against their philosophy. Yoga should be for everyone.

Suggested donation: $10

Mat rental: $2
results.name: !!New Year Yoga Social!!

results.description:
Unlike most Meetups, you don't sign up for these events--no RSVP required. This is a first come/first served, drop-in service offering one-on-one counseling for LGBT individuals and couples.

Two Identity House volunteer peer counselors staff the Walk-In Center for 2 hours, each Saturday and Sunday night. Each session with a client or couple is about 45 minutes.

What is a peer counselor? The word, "peer", means "equal". In this usage, a counselor and a client are on level ground. The counselor is not a therapist and does not provide professional therapy.

As peers, we have the opportunity to share as equals with our clients. This means that, unlike therapists, we can share our personal experiences, so that the client knows there are others who have been through a similar situation.

What does a peer counselor do? Using active listening skills, empathy, and the sharing of experiences, the counselors help clients clarify their thoughts and feelings; and explore various options or solutions.

What else can the counselors do? Sometimes clients just come in to talk and that's all they need, but if clients feel that they might benefit from referrals to other resources, the counselor will discuss with them: short-term peer counseling (8 weekly, 1-hour one-on-one visits), therapists, discussion groups, and other community resources.

Our outreach is supported by donations from Identity House members and our clients. We do ask for a reasonable donation at the conclusion of the counseling session, but no one is ever turned away because they are unable to donate.

For more information about Identity House or how you can support our work with a donation, please visit our website: www.identityhouse.org.
results.name: Now, An LGBT Walk-In Center on Thursdays Nights

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

results.description:
Join DM Tom Gilbert in his first Wildpig RPG!

A pale body lays among the dark leaves, the blood long since cooled in the late autumn chill. Frost is forming on the ground, coating the corpse in silver. It shines in the dawn light, while the dark red blood freezes on her neck. In the nearby village of Lyalintsi, Magister Illian Antonov is about to discover his daughter is missing. Another young girl from his community is gone, and he must face his people with no more answers than before. The darkness of the forest is closing in on the village, and the night is full of horrors. The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. Maya Antonov is Dead is a campaign for D&D 5E. The focus is on the horror surrounding the players, and the challenge of surviving in a world set against them. Characters will begin at first level, and advancement will be challenging.

Races: Human, Elf, Dwarf, Halfling, Tiefling.
Classes: Barbarian, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Fighter, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue, Warlock, Wizard
results.name: D&D 5E: Maya Antonov is Dead session 3

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 3 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 3 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 3 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place: Fogo de Chão is an authentic Brazilian steakhouse (churrascaria) that has been setting the standard in Brazil for the past 35 years. The menu includes delectable cuts of grilled meats such as sizzling steaks, lamb, chicken and pork carved tableside by Brazilian trained gaucho chefs as well as a lighter seafood option. Also offered is a gourmet salad and sides bar consisting of salads, fresh-cut vegetables, cured meats and imported cheeses, as well as a variety of traditional Brazilian side dishes, delectable desserts and award-winning wine list.

Please also note that our visit occurs during restaurant week, thus we can take advantage of their usual dinner menu for only $38! :-D

http://fogodechao.com/menu


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Fogo de Chao - Brazilian Steakhouse

About IMC Club: IMC Club, through its nationwide chapters, provides organized “hangar flying” focused on building proficiency in instrument flying. IMC Club believes that safety and proficiency are developed through education and experience. Monthly meetings use real world scenarios to engage our members and allow them to share and build their experience. Open to everyone. You do not have to be instrument rated to attend. results.description:
Let's go to one of my new fave restaurants - Massa Coastal in Mamaroneck on Thursday January 28th starting at 7pm. I'll make a reservation for 8 and your $3 will secure your spot.  A few of us ate here during the past restaurant week and were blown away.. so we left promising that we'd be back.. and so we will! :)   There is a price fix four course meal for two...that is $29 per person.  Check out their menu and prices : http://www.massacoastal.com/

Growing up along the Italian shores of the Mediterranean Sea, Chef Francesco often spent time catching fish with a spear gun. Even though he moved away from Italy, the executive chef at Massa' Coastal Italian Restaurant hasn't lost his sense of culinary adventure. He still visits Italy multiple times per year, helping him stay in touch with his roots and allow his food to show customers 'who he is'. He flies fresh fish in from the Mediterranean and makes daily trips to the Fulton Fish Market to prepare what he calls ocean-to-table cuisine.  Westchester Magazine praised Chef Francesco's eye for fresh fish and his delicate hand with sauces. The two converge with the pesce e crostacei, a fresh pick of the day grilled or oven-roasted and dressed in a sauce that enhances the seafood’s flavors. The menu also features a variety of steaks and pastas.


Some comments by other diners include: "Massa's fish was so wonderful last night: whole branzino expertly flavored, with provincial sauce, carpaccio  of wild salmon, shrimp and swordfish belly skewered over great Gnocchi.
Even the new focacchia was special.  And the owner picked out a fine 2009 Montepulchiano which went with the meal.   I feel so fortunate that this NYC quality restaurant is in our neighborhood."

Another says, "We moved to Mamaroneck from Williamsburg Brooklyn with average expectations for dining in the area.  Restaurant after restaurant we were left satiated but unimpressed.  One evening we popped into Massa, conveniently across the street from us.  The staff is well versed in the menu, knowledgable, professional and warm.  The food...it blew us away.  Clearly prepared thoughtfully and with love, the proportions are healthy without being overwhelming.  The chef specials are creative and complex, leaving you wanting to try everything on the menu.  Dishes that stand out: Polpo Alla Griglia (grilled wild octopus), every pasta (homemade in house), and the lovely Pesce e Crostacei which allows you to customize the preparation and sauce of your choice of fish.  The dishes are gorgeous, the lighting romantic, and the music is hip and lounge appropriate.  Try the specials as they always knock it out of the park.  We have since become regulars here!!  The owner Francesco greets guests personally and is truly a wonderful host.  Definitely a must for fine dining in Westchester county, perhaps the best italian around!"

And one more said, "I cannot even describe the amazing experience my boyfriend and I had at this restaurant.  If you want a true dining experience without an uptight, cold atmosphere, Massa' is the place to go! This restaurant runs a seamless operation - Vinny being the manager, and our server, couldn't have been better! He was polite, accommodating and basically recommended everything we ate - and we couldn't have been happier with his recommendations.We started with a few appetizers..the fish was SO fresh, and the burrata is to die for! For dinner we had the big eye tuna and the branzino...both were out of this world (and Vinny's recommendations)
Of course we ordered dessert - Cannoli Chips & Zeppole's...the two of us wanted to lick our plates by the end of the night! You will not leave this restaurant hungry, that's for sure! This restaurant will not disappoint and we cannot wait to go back!!!"
results.how_to_find_us: please find us at the Bar
results.name: Let's go to Massa Coastal for Terry's Birthday! Mamaroneck

results.description:
BRING INDOOR SHOES OR SNEAKERS

Permit Disclosure: We have a Permit!

(Leaders Britney N & Matt M)

Street Soccer USA's unique court with walls and medium sized goals creates a very fast paced and exciting match!  4v4 with at least 3 teams rotating every 10 minutes and switch goalies every 5 minutes.

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Game restarts from goalie
Kick-ins.. no throw ins 
Corner kicks

Directions:

By Car - Cross the RFK Bridge and take the I-278 exit towards Randalls Island. Turn right onto Central Rd until it turns into Hell Gate Circle. Turn Right crossing under the RFK Bridge onto Sunken Garden Loop.  Help SEC is across from Fields 90-91.

By Bus - Take the M-35 bus which leaves from 125th St and Lexington Ave in front of the Duane Reade. It is the second to last stop on the bus route.

By Train - Take the 4-5 train to 125th St. Transfer to the M-35 bus.

If you have any problems please call Matt on (    ) or Britney on  (  ).

PS2G promotes clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $5 via paypal, (includes insurance, permit, security guard) 100% of the proceeds go to Street Soccer USA. Learn more about our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Street Soccer USA is sports for social change. Using our entrepreneurial instinct as well as evidence based practices, we make a measurable difference in the lives of undeserved youth in urban areas and special needs populations, including homeless families, adults, people in recovery, among others.

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? Go take jujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

• Minimum 6 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
This will be the first session of the Grief Recovery Support Group. Location is still to be determined but it will most likely be in an office in midtown or downtown Manhattan.

This group will be using the methodology of the Grief Recovery Institute (https://www.griefrecoverymethod.com) to help you move through your grief towards recovery.  Regardless of the loss you've experienced, this method will assist you in getting complete with and saying goodbye to the pain you're experiencing as a result of the loss.  Honesty, Confidentiality and Respect are paramount for this group.  

The group is set up as an 8 session series, so please be sure to adjust your schedule in order to attend each session.  Your success is dependent on your attendance, participation and completion of the assignments.  You will be paired with another participant during the sessions, so please know that others will be counting on you to be there.  No two session are the same; each session will include new materials and information.  

In participating in this group, you're agreeing to read sections of The Grief Recovery Handbook and do the assigned work each week.  The reading and assignments aren't difficult or lengthy, however, they do require a willingness to delve into what may be a challenging topic for you.  If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out in advance to make sure this is the group for you.  

Due to the personal nature of this group, only those who have signed up will be admitted--drop ins or visitors can be disruptive to the flow of the group.

There is no charge for the group, however there is a suggested donation of $15 per session to help cover the cost of the materials and the rented space.
results.name: Grief Recovery Method Support Group first Meetup

results.description:
CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS! 


Welcome To The Writer’s Room 
 This is the only class of its kind—run like a real writer’s room on a 30 minute TV comedy series, taught by a professional showrunner with over 25 years of industry experience—and featuring the work of 12 talented student writers. You’ll not only learn how to write a half hour spec episode or pilot that can open the door to a job in Hollywood, you’ll actually write one for the show of your choice, and collaborate on the development of a script for a different show each week, just like they do in the big leagues.

What You’ll Learn
You’ll learn the elements of a successful half-hour comedy series, and how to write a pilot or spec episode that shows off your ability to create what every network, studio, and series producer is looking for: a professional grade script plays within the structure of the series for which you want to write, while showing off your unique talent as a writer. You’ll not only have real world experience of working in a TV writer’s room, you’ll also connect with a community of writers you can depend on, and the knowledge you need to write a professional grade pilot you can use to pursue a career in Hollywood. A Teacher You Can Trust With more than 25 years of Hollywood experience, Jerome has been a showrunner, writer, and producer on some of the most successful half-hour series in history, including “The Jeffersons,” “The Golden Girls,” “Frasier,” “The Nanny,” and “Married…with Children.” Now, he brings a lifetime of experience directly to you as your teacher, showrunner, mentor and coach.

Learn more.

NORMAL COST: $899

MEETUP MEMBERS: Check out the first day of this  10-week workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class Size is Strictly Limited To 12 Students To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. 

You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!

results.description:
Security question required (RSVP to answer)!


The levels of controversy in the Bitcoin ecosystem have reached new heights. At the center of the current schism rests the soft vs. hard fork debate and how it relates to governance structures and code development. This event will allow us to explore this topic.


The event will be structured to allow each side of the debate to express their opinions without talking past one another; discussion will begin with members stating the assumptions on which their logic rest. Once assumptions have been stated, members representing each side of the debate will be given the opportunity to question those assumptions.


While the hard vs soft fork debate is predominantly technical, it reaches beyond that into questions of ideological merit. Discussions of this nature will be allowed but will be moderated to avoid endless debate. Here is the main topic for discussion, listed below are subtopics. Feel free to suggest other topics in the comments section:


hard vs. soft forks -- when do they make sense?


• Uncontroversial vs Controversial forks (95% vs 75%)

• Soft segwit vs Hard 2MB bump for immediate release 

• Soft vs hard segwit


• Is democratic code development healthy for Bitcoin? / If Bitcoin is neither democracy or dictatorship, what is it? 

• Layer 2--is it the best method to scale Bitcoin? Is it inevitability?
results.how_to_find_us: Please get a badge at the security desk. Enter via escalators in Grand Central.
results.name: On Forks and Consensus: A Debate

NYFG members,


We invite you to the upcoming premiere screening of “Murder of a President” on Thursday, January 28 at 7:00 p.m. The screening will be held at the Directors Guild of America on West 57th. The cast and filmmakers will be on site. You can find all the event details and get a free ticket below: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/premiere-screening-of-murder-of-a-president-tickets-20919769594

You can also visit our site below:

http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/americanexperience/films/garfield/

ABOUT THE FILM

Based on Candice Millard's best-seller, Murder of a President is the story of James A. Garfield, one of the most extraordinary men ever elected president, his shooting by a deluded madman named Charles Guiteau, and its bizarre and tragic aftermath. Featuring Tony Award winner Shuler Hensley as Garfield, Kathryn Erbe (Law & Order: Criminal Intent) as his beloved wife Lucretia, and Will Janowitz (The Sopranos, Boardwalk Empire) as the assassin, the sweeping and dramatic story of Garfield's life combines science and medicine, party politics and love.

AMERICAN EXPERIENCE: Murder of a President premieres Tuesday, February 2 at 9pm on WNET and PBS stations nationwide.

We'll see you at the screening!

TJ Collins

www.newyorkfilmgroup.com

https://www.facebook.com/Newyorkfilmgroup/

results.description:
Join us for an open-format discussion of effective altruism topics! If anyone would like to make announcements or propose a discussion topic feel free to do so.

For newcomers, read on:

If you aren't already familiar with the wider EA movement, I'm glad to have reached your eyeballs! Effective altruism is about recognizing the importance of using our lives to do the most good we can and looking for ways to help others that are high-impact and well-supported by evidence. This approach may sound obvious, but careful consideration of the impact of different strategies for doing good can lead to some surprising, and even controversial, conclusions. Ethical philosophy, career strategies, economics, and persuasion methods play important roles in these considerations, so EA attracts smart people and provides intellectually invigorating topics of discussion.

A great way to start learning about our perspective is to watch Peter Singer's TED talk: 
http://www.ted.com/talks/peter_singer_the_why_and_how_of_effective_altruism?language=en

If it piques your interest, have a look through the introductory links on the Effective Altruism Forum, or read Will MacAskill's excellent book on the topic, Doing Good Better -- and let us know what you think!

Feel free to send me a message if you'd like to know more. Hope to see you there!

-Chris
results.name: Effective Altruism Meetup
