results.description:
We're excited to begin the new year with Ramsey Nasser, an amazing computer scientist, game designer, educator, and all-around person, presenting on PushPull++ by Lipp, Wonka, and Muller.

Intro 

Of all the ways to manipulate a 3D mesh, the “push/pull” technique popularized by SketchUp is one of the most approachable and fun. PushPull++ is a recent paper that elaborates on the technique, cleaning up a lot of edge cases and unlocking new features, using wonderfully straightforward math. The potential for 3D modeling tools or procedural mesh generation APIs built on these simple ideas is very exciting.

The paper presents the technique and the tool that the authors built. I will focus on the technique, as that’s the part I loved more in this paper.


**Also, check out this video on the work!**

Bio

Ramsey Nasser (@ra) is a computer scientist, game designer, and educator based in Brooklyn. He researches programming languages by building tools to make computation more expressive and implementing projects that question the basic assumptions we make about code itself. His games playfully push people out of their comfort zones, and are often written in experimental programming languages of his design. A former Eyebeam fellow and a member of Kitchen Table Coders, when he is not reasoning about abstract unintuitive machines, he builds and maintains vintage motorcycles.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

TwoSigma - Platinum Sponsor of the New York chapter

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Details

Doors open at 7 pm; the presentation will begin at 7:30 pm; and, yes, there will be refreshments of all kinds and pizza. A little different than previous PWLs, you'll have to check-in with security with your Name/ID. If you have any issues getting in, please contact  [masked] or email us directly.

After Ramsey presents the paper, we will open up the floor to discussion and questions.  

We hope that you'll read the paper before the meetup, but don't stress if you can't. If you have any questions, thoughts, or related information, please visit #pwlnyc on slack, our GitHub repository, where you can also find the paper, or add to the discussion on this event's thread.

Additionally, if you have any papers you want to add to the repository above (papers that you love!), please send us a pull request. Also, if you have any ideas/questions about this meetup or the Papers-We-Love org, just open up an issue.
results.how_to_find_us: Between Ave. of the Americas and Varick St.
results.name: Ramsey Nasser on PushPull++

results.description:
We'll start off the new year with Helene Wecker's breakout, Manhattan-set literary fantasy The Golem and the Jinni, which was a finalist for the Nebula and World Fantasy awards in 2014.

Here's the blurb: 

﻿In The Golem and the Jinni, a chance meeting between mythical beings takes readers on a dazzling journey through cultures in turn-of-the-century New York.

Chava is a golem, a creature made of clay, brought to life to by a disgraced rabbi who dabbles in dark Kabbalistic magic and dies at sea on the voyage from Poland. Chava is unmoored and adrift as the ship arrives in New York harbor in 1899.

Ahmad is a jinni, a being of fire born in the ancient Syrian desert, trapped in an old copper flask, and released in New York City, though still not entirely free

Ahmad and Chava become unlikely friends and soul mates with a mystical connection. Marvelous and compulsively readable, Helene Wecker's debut novel The Golem and the Jinni weaves strands of Yiddish and Middle Eastern literature, historical fiction and magical fable, into a wondrously inventive and unforgettable tale.

I'll choose a location soon. Please do let me know if you have any suggestions for good meeting spots.

results.description:
*** 1/28 3D THURSDAY - Download and Print: User-Generated Content Platforms for 3D Printing ***
Join us this week and discover the best 3D printable content from across the internet. Thingiverse and beyond! Led by 3D printing evangelist Keith Ozar.


So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 


We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
TICKETS ON OUR SITE

---------------------------------------

Please note that you must have a ticket from Eventbrite (purchased through our site) to attend.

RSVP'ing on Meetup alone will not get you in.

Last Things First: A Redesign Strategy That Actually Works

Presented by Vanessa Koch & Sam Goertler, Product & Design at Asana</a>


Price: <a href="http://www.designersandgeeks.com/events/last-things-first-redesign-strategy-that-actually-works?utm_source=makesenseofanymess_meetup&utm_medium=meetup&utm_campaign=meetup_nyc">$15 for early birds, $20 for regular


Design trends come and go faster than ever these days. The style you agonized over last year may already look dated compared to the new hotness. And feature development is so rapid that even the simplest UI can turn into a complicated mess of functionality overnight. This brings us to the inevitable redesign. If you've ever worked on one, you're probably familiar with high stakes, massive amounts of uncertainty, and constant fear of user backlash. Join us to learn about a new approach to redesigning that mitigates the risks and guarantees you'll win over the hearts of your users.

Vanessa Koch is a product designer and design manager at Asana. She led their recent redesign, which launched last fall to critical acclaim and 99% opt-in rate. 

Sam Goertler is a product manager at Asana. She partnered with Vanessa on the redesign and now leads Asana's new team in Brooklyn.


Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks


Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.
results.name: Last Things First: A Redesign Strategy That Actually Works

On January 28, 2016, we'll benefit NYC Animal Defense League.

NYC Animal Defense League (NYCADL) is a collective organization dedicated to fighting animal abuse and exploitation.

Web: http://www.nycadl.com/ 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/NYCADL 

Twitter and Instagram @nycadl_

Support NYC ADL: make donations, and buy many raffle tickets! Check back for raffle prizes.

Food by Los Veganos Hermanos! 

Delicious tacos created by the makers of Monk's Meats!

http://www.instagram.com/losveganoshermanosnyc

----

Vegan Drinks is a monthly social networking* event for people interested in promoting veganism and advocating for animal rights. Vegan Drinks’ mission is to bring together a diverse group of people—from cupcake aficionados to animal lawyers to veg*ns of all stripes in between—to build new coalitions and promote the sharing of resources. Vegan Drinks is for newbies and oldies. All we expect is an interest in animal rights, veganism and the pursuit of after-work fun. Show up and introduce yourself, pass around business cards (if you've got ‘em) and embarrass yourself at least once an hour.

*Although we think love is grand, Vegan Drinks is not a singles’ event. But, if you happen to meet the love of your life at Vegan Drinks, don't forget to invite us to the wedding!

-- 

What to do?

Be friendly! We'll be passing out nametags, so you can march right up to someone and greet them by name.

Promote! If you're representing an organization (either as an employee or volunteer or general supporter), talk up the organization and the work you've been involved in. If you're representing you, talk up your vegan and AR interests, your favorite restaurant, your dream job for animals, your blog, etc., etc.

Make a shout out! Starting around 8:30pm, we'll turn down the music and encourage people to promote themselves, their groups and/or causes for 30 seconds. If you represent a veg*n or animal rights group, come prepared with your spiel and literature!

Sip a drink (alcoholic or non-alcoholic, we don't care!) and relax with like-minded folks for a couple of hours.

What to bring?

Business cards

Pamphlets promoting your organization

Tip money for the cute bartenders

Your A-game

Vegan Drinks takes place the last Thursday of the month (usually; check the date to be sure!) from 7pm to 10pm. It's an alcohol-based event and it's at a bar, so you have to be at least 21 years old.

If you have questions or comments, contact us at [masked].

There is no dress code. If you come straight from work in a suit, we promise not to make fun of you. Entrance is free, but the booze is not. Remember to tip your friendly bartenders!

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.


Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?  Now You Can!”

Come to  our Second West Side Talkers  meeting of 2016 and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday January 28th,  2016  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required! 

Please RSVP to ([masked] or [masked])
results.name: Develop Your Public Speaking Skills While Having Fun!

results.description:
Four consecutive Thursday evenings, January 21 – February 11

When the Sea Rose 400 Feet: The Hudson Valley and the End of the Ice Age

with Dr. Bill Menke, earth scientist and naturalist 

Thursday, January28, at 7:00 PM 

Travel back in time with Dr. Bill Menke, Professor ofEarth and Environmental Sciences at Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, and seelife emerge in the Hudson Valley as the great continental glacier of the IceAge melted and receded.

Dr. Bill Menke is a naturalist with a great love of the outdoors and a deep appreciation of the natural beauty of the Hudson Valley who teaches at Columbia University’s Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, whose campus is built atop the PalisadesCliffs. He says, “My studies have taken me to geologic faults,volcanoes, glaciers, and rock formations around the world, but I have always returned to New York, because, to me, it is the most fascinating place of all. I am currently studying the deep roots of the continent beneath our feet.

RiverTalks 2016 opens with Hudson RiverLighthouses, a presentation by local historian Scott Craven, on Thursday, January 21, 2016 at 7:00 pm at the Sarah Lawrence College Center for the Urban River at Beczak (SLC CURB). Free Off-street parking. Suggested donation $5. centerfortheurbanriver.org RiverTalks brings together inquisitive minds and a widerange of experts for informal presentations about a variety of Hudson Rivertopics. The program is co-sponsored by SLC CURB and the Yonkers Paddling & Rowing Club (YPRC). RiverTalks Winter 2016 series is curated by Lee Reiser, anavid kayaker, board member of YPRC, and Atlantic division director of recreation and promotion for the American Canoe Association.

This series, entering its sixth year, is held at SLC CURB, an environmental education, research, and community center on the banks of theHudson River just north of the Yonkers Pier.
results.name: River Talks When the River Rose 400 ft

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

We gather to share and create sacred rhythmic space for the intent of healing, self-empowerment and joy. We celebrate this space with tribal rhythms as we honor Fall release and prepare for Winter stillness, recognizing the interrelatedness of all things.

~ This ancient wisdom of sound therapy has been with us all along ~ Music has traditionally been used in healing practices for centuries. Now we have a great deal of scientific evidence to support what the ancients knew instinctively. Sound Can Heal!

The Psychedelic Society of Brooklyn seeks to engage its membership in preliminary discussions about advocacy work we could engage in here in New York. Fellow lawyer and blogger Noah Potter and cannabis activist Doug Greene will help me lead a conversation on possible future projects. Doug’s background in advocacy is extensive. He is the Legislative Director of Empire State NORML and Patient Advocacy Coordinator of GITA.


We envision this event, which we hope is a first of many, as a meeting of activists that want to take practical steps in New York to help normalize and legalize psychedelics. But at this point, we're simply brainstorming. 

Example topics of conversation and potential advocacy projects are:

1. A petition for clemency for those in prison for possession of psychedelic substances. This petition would further highlight the draconian nature of the drug war in general, while focusing on its impact on the psychedelic community.

2. There’s an FDA process dedicated to the rescheduling of these substances at the federal level, but is there room for an independent path at the state/local level? Mirroring the cannabis movement where states legalized marijuana in contravention of federal law, are there steps we could take in NY? Examples would be obtaining local political support for the establishment of psychedelic therapy centers to combat substance abuse and PTSD.

3. A list of New Yorkers that would be willing to come out of the psychedelic closet. This “out” list would serve to reduce the stigma associated with psychedelic use.

Note, this is a brainstorming session, and an opportunity to gauge membership interest for this sort of advocacy work. No concrete steps will be taken at this meeting. 

We look forward to seeing you there, and to hearing your ideas.

Regards,

Danny, Doug, and Noah
results.name: Advocacy Brainstorming Meeting

results.description:
Joyce Chinese cuisine in River Edge is an authentic Szechuan restaurant. Highlights include the universally loved soup buns, which are little meat dumplings that contain soup inside along with the meatball, and hot pot dishes, which come to you still cooking over a burner in a fancy chinese-style plate set up.

The place has a wonderful atmosphere and is BYOB. Bring something; I know I'll probably be bringing beer and some kind of Asian liquor.

I recommend we order family style; order a bunch of dishes and share. Even if not, I really prefer not to bug the staff and simply divvy up the check by looking at the receipt and doing the math, so please guys. Last time at the Japanese place the guy went bug eyed when we asked for separate checks.

Oh and for those of you who like that kind of thing (I know I do), they have the weird stuff, like frogs and some organ meats. I can tell you firsthand that Chinese style beef tendon has a wonderfully chewy texture, if little flavor, but tripe is just awful. I've had intestines before and they were awful, but it may have been the way they were prepared. Oh and I believe they have abalone, which everyone should try once at least, it's a wondeful seafood delicacy, such mild flavor, though the way they make it it migh not come with the shell, which is part of the fun.

This restaurant is located in that strip mall in River Edge on Kinderkamack, you know the one I'm talking about, the only one in River Edge I think. Take note that there is parking in the back - when you see the sign that says Kress Plaza, right where that sign is there is the entrance to the back parking lot, the driveway and lot slope down towards the train tracks and river. From there, there is a rear entrance where you have to go up some stairs to enter the restaurant.

For reference here is Tommy:Eats' reviews (warning, the food porn will make you hungry):
http://www.tommyeats.com/tommyeats/2014/05/joyce-chinese-cuisine-authentic-sichuan-in-river-edge-nj.html
http://www.tommyeats.com/tommyeats/2014/06/joyce-chinese-cuisine-another-authentic-sichuan-meal-in-river-edge-nj.html
http://www.tommyeats.com/tommyeats/2016/01/joyce-chinese-river-edge-nj-the-same-as-it-used-to-be-excellent.html

Their menu can be seen here:
http://www.joycechinese.com/index.html
results.name: Joyce Chinese - Soup buns, hot pot, and more

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

Set at a seaside resort, Gustav (Craig Smith) befriends an impressionable highly successful young artist, Adolph (Josh Tyson). Under Gustav’s relentless questioning Adolph’s fears of infidelity of his novelist wife Tekla (Elise Stone) come ragingly to the forefront. It ultimately becomes clear that the manipulative Gustav is scheming a psychological deadly plot in this fatal sexual--part carnival funhouse--triangle. Described   as  “chilling but surprisingly comedic” Los Angels Times 

Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.” Discount tickets for New York Theatre Under $25 Meetup @ $15 each. Use the code “Meet3” when ordering your tickets either by phone at[masked] or online at

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

How To Build A Fire is a storytelling series set within the visually surprising, kinetic, and energized space of Open Source Gallery. The series is the brainchild of the poet Terence Degnan, who for a year, curated and hosted countless storytellers from all walks of life while inviting guest curators along the way to help to diversify the voices. He has passed on the curatorial and hosting duties to his friends and colleagues Kate Hill Cantrill and Dennis Norris and they intend to maintain the spontaneous mix of characters, themes, ideas, while opening up the series to include musical, visual, and other creative ways of enhancing the art of telling a story.

Storytellers have been invited to explore the theme "Silent Violence," a topic inspired by the many incidences that have occurred and have been made visible (very much through social media) this past year or so that have prompted the #Blacklivesmatter movement, as well as movements to raise awareness regarding the dangers facing the LGBTQ communities.
results.name: HOW TO BUILD A FIRE: Silent Violence

results.description:
Join us for our new open house potluck dinner night! It's for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC and anyone (over 18) who wants to learn more about the OM practice and what we do! We will be playing one of our favorite games, Hot Seats! 

Hot Seats is a fun communication game where one person at a time can volunteer to have the attention the rest of the group placed on them for 1-2 minutes while they can be asked any question on any topic. You can chose to lie, tell the truth, or pass, but it's always encouraged to let your true self come out in a safe a fun environment.

Whether you are someone who already OMs, you are curious and want to meet some of the OM community, or you just want to enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too! If you can't or don't have time, just bring $10 to drop in the jar. 

It's a casual atmosphere and one of our favorite ways to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 and lock at 8:10 sharp, so please be on time!

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]  
Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

Beginning in 2016, this group meets on the 4th Thursday of each month to discuss various works of "modern" masters or upcoming talent in SF, fantasy, paranormal, horror and related genres. It also occasionally explores classics and the 'masters' of the classics.

Ancillary Justice by Ann Leckie

Winner of the Hugo, Nebula, British Science Fiction, Locus and Arthur C. Clarke Awards.  On a remote, icy planet, the soldier known as Breq is drawing closer to completing her quest.  Once, she was the Justice of Toren - a colossal starship with an artificial intelligence linking thousands of soldiers in the service of the Radch, the empire that conquered the galaxy.  Now, an act of treachery has ripped it all away, leaving her with one fragile human body, unanswered questions, and a burning desire for vengeance.

(Todd selection)

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
Visas for Startups: H-1B and Alternatives

**Due to the overwhelming popularity of our first BizWorkshop we decided to run this again **

In this workshop, Lisa Eisenberg, Esq., an experienced immigration attorney working primarily with technology startups, will discuss H-1B and other visa options for foreign startup founders and employees.  We will talk about best practices in filing H-1B petitions for small, recently formed companies. We will also discuss the lesser-known option of O-1 visa - an ideal solution for many startup founders and employees who satisfy the regulatory criteria. Lisa will share her experience in successfully obtaining this coveted visa for entrepreneurs, software developers, web designers, UX designers and other tech professionals.  She will also provide an overview of other visas for work and training (L-1, E, J-1, etc.) Lastly, we will cover President Obama’s executive actions aimed to benefit foreign-owned startups and their founders, including the proposed “significant public benefit” parole program for entrepreneurs. 

Agenda:

8:15 a.m. - 8:45 am 
Registration check-in & continental breakfast 

8:45 a.m. – 9:30 a.m. 
Presentation

9:30 a.m. – 10 a.m. 
Presentation

About the speaker: 

Lisa Eisenberg, Esq. is the Founder and Principal of Eisenberg Law Firm PLLC, an immigration law firm specializing in visa solutions for tech startups and founders. The firm’s narrow focus and specialized expertise help overcome many challenges faced by startups in the immigration process.

Foreign entrepreneurs often have a difficult time getting a work visa in the U.S. because our country does not offer a “startup visa” or any other option well-suited for startup founders.  This prevents many founders from legally working in the U.S., effectively managing their businesses, or obtaining funding.  

Eisenberg Law Firm PLLC has the experience to utilize existing work visas for the unique needs of tech startup founders in technology and other fields. The firm also assists small and mid-size U.S. tech companies seeking H-1B, L-1, O-1 and other work visas for foreign professionals.
results.name: Visas for Startups: H-1B and Alternatives Presented by Lisa Eisenberg, Esq

Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. results.description:
You need to REGISTER with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at the following link:  

http://registercommunitypass.net/Englewood

There, you will be able to pay the $40 fee online.  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL remaining 9!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class 2:  Transfer Activities

Review & New:  Each week we will review the essentials of working in a classroom, such as how to sit with others for circle time, how to complete a "work cycle" from choosing an activity to returning it to its correct place, and how to work at a table or on the floor.  

New this week will be traditional Montessori transfer activities. For our younger students, this will mean grasping larger items to move them from one container to another.  For the older ones, we'll start pouring smaller items.

Activities:  In addition to materials already out, many of which involve transfer, grasping and pouring will be available.

Adult Learning:  Adults will learn about how controls of error are built right into Montessori exercises and why, what a "point of interest" is in an activity, and various spontaneous information.

A Peek Ahead:  After your child's first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

     Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

     Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a mellon baller, pouring

     Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing 

     Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eye dropper, clothes pins
results.name: Class 2 - Transfer Activities

results.description:
Please refrain from bringing large bags, as all items larger than 11-inches by 15-inches by 5-inches must be checked.

Once inside, feel free to go through the exhibition at your own pace, either on your own or with your fellow MEETUP members. 


We'll be seeing - - - 

Jackson Pollock: A Collection Survey, 1934 – 1954


 Above:                                                                                                            • One: Number 31, 1950  by Jackson Pollack (1950)                          • Oil and enamel paint on canvas                                                          • 8 feet, 10 inches by 17 feet, 5-&-5/8 Inches (269.5 by 530.8        cm)                                                                                                  • Sidney and Harriet Janis Collection Fund                                    • © 2015 Pollock-Krasner Foundation/Artists Rights Society          (ARS), New York

This exhibition offers a concise but detailed survey of the work of Jackson Pollock (American, 1912–1956). It tracks his artistic evolution from the 1930s and early 1940s, when he made loosely figurative images based on mythical or primeval themes, to the late 1940s and early 1950s, when he pioneered the radical abstractions for which he is best known by pouring and dripping paint onto canvas or paper. The exhibition features approximately 50 works—paintings, drawings, and prints—from the Museum’s collection, which is unparalleled in the breadth, depth, and quality of its Pollock holdings. Among the paintings on view is One: Number 31, 1950 (1950), arguably Pollock’s greatest masterpiece, and one of his largest canvases. Exceedingly rare and little-known engravings, lithographs, screenprints, and drawings are also included, highlighting an underappreciated side of one of the most important and influential American artists of the 20th century. By bringing together works made using a range of materials and techniques—both traditional and unorthodox—the exhibition underscores the relentless experimentation and emphasis on process that was at the heart of Pollock’s creativity.
results.how_to_find_us: PLEASE NOTE: The East 54th Street entrance is used on Free Fridays. Joel will be on line at 3 P.M. with an 8½-inch by 11-inch MEETUP sign - the size of a piece of typewriter paper. Free Friday hours are 4 P.M. to 8 P.M.
results.name: See Jackson Pollock: A Collection Survey, 1934 –1954 on MoMA's Free Friday

results.description:
Sugarbush Resort


Sugarbush, located in Northern Vermont's Mad River Valley, is one of Vermont's favortie ski areas. Sugarbush consits of two mountains, Mt. Ellen and Lincoln Peak, and is home to more than 4,000 acres, with nearly 600 skiable acres plus 2,000 acres of backcountry skiing in the Slide Brook Wilderness area. "The 'Bush" has beginner terrain (20%), Intermediate (45%) and advanced to expert (35%) accessed via 16 lifts that provide the area with a 25,463 person uphill capacity. The 23,000 square-foot day lodge features cathedral ceilings, a food court, and the Castlerock Pub complete with an outdoor patio and barbeque area. Timbers, a post-and-beam restaurant attached to the Clay Brook residences, offers upscale cuisine and is open to the public in all four seasons. The Mad River Valley is also home to 38 lodges (6,600 beds) and 19 restaurants for guests to enjoy.


Mountainside Condos (Ski-In Ski-Out) 


The location of these one bedroom plus loft units makes them the ideal setting for small or big group alike. This complex, which is in close proximity to Lincoln Peak, offers a private outdoor pool for summertime enjoyment. Each of the units features a complete kitchen, living room with cable television, and private balcony.

*** Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details. ***

Depart 5:50 PM from NJ: (NJ Transit Ramsey Route 17) 1 Spring St, Ramsey, NJ 07446 (Map)


Return: Depart from Sugarbush at 3:30 PM on Sunday & get back to NYC around 9:30 PM and Flushing  10:00 PM.

Trip Includes: 2 nights accommodation at Mountainside Condos based on sharing queen/double/sofa bed and 6 persons sharing 1 bedroom, a loft & a sleep sofa unit or 4 persons sharing 1 bedroom & a sleeper sofa unit (Walk to slopes). 2 days all mountain lift tickets at Sugarbush. Round trip Benz Sprinter van or car transportation from NYC & Flushing.

Cost: Early Birds $329 for first 10 spots; Regular $359 for last 10 spots. Self drive is $50 less. Also, additional $50 reduction for drivers for giving each passenger & their equipment/luggage a ride.

Train: Montclair-Boonton Line to Bloomfield Station (~30 minute trip from NY Penn Station). Schedule here - https://www.njtransit.com/pdf/rail/R0030.pdf

PARKING

SAFE SPACE & ANTI-HARASSMENT POLICY
This is a safe and inclusive space where we respect people of all backgrounds. Please help us all be mindful of our speech and behavior. results.description:
You voted, and I listened! The topic for our next meetup, which you all voted on unanimously, is "Introduction to Icelandic!" This meetup will focus primarily on introducing you to the Icelandic language. I will discuss how Icelandic functions as a "case language" and other points specific to its unique grammar.

I will also have everyone learn some basic phrases and vocabulary and the brave ones can practice with one another. If you're too shy, just absorb what you can and have fun!

As usual, I will come prepared with printed materials so, as in the past, please keep me up to date with your RSVP's (which most of you have been kind enough to do) as I have materials accounted for each of you who respond. So if plans change, no biggie, you'll catch the next one. Your responses help me a great deal with my preparation.

So dust off your left-brain hemisphere and take the language learning plunge. You'll be hooked, guaranteed!
results.name: Icelandic 101...Come and Learn the Basics!

results.description:
Happy New Year!!! Hope you all enjoyed the holidays. Apologies for the very sparse meetups over the last year or so. We have all been tied down with the usual New York fast life but looking to change things in 2016 and make the meet-ups regular and planned out way earlier. 

For 2016's first meetup, we will convene at The Press Box bar near the UN. Date is Friday January 29th. 


As usual, the social is very informal, and simply a means to meet other Kenyan ( and friends of Kenya) professionals, students, and residents in the city. There are no formalities or speeches. We all wear name tags and simply network. For those of you who might have not attended, it is a great experience. We also usually invite the Kenyan representatives to the UN Mission and the ambassadors have joined us a few times. 

Looking forward to meeting you and feel free to bring a friend along. If you have any questions, please feel free to email back or post on message board.

Thanks much!

Best,

Peter.
results.how_to_find_us: On 2nd Avenue between 49th and 50th street
results.name: 2016 First meetup, Kenya NYC Professionals

results.description:
Are you tired of taking class after class and only getting discouraged that you are never going to create any quality art? Have you heard million times that you are an amazing being and you want to experience it? 

 It will blow your mind when you see what you are capable of and what you have been missing. Your life might change as a side effect of learning to paint with this method. If you are an artist then you just might discover immense inner strength and power to create the life you want, not just art. 

The technique and knowledge of this course is based on the oldest tradition on the planet. the Vedic Tradition. Hundreds of people have succeeded and my experience of 30 plus years as a teacher in different countries will help you succeed as well. 

 If you are not sure, please reach out! The discovery session has a lot of stand alone value and not only will help you understand what the workshop is about but also will give you insights 

Suggested Supply List:

1. Multi media sketch book - . We create a reference book so that you can go back to the ideas and be able to work independently after the course.

2. Pencils, erasers.

3. Colored pencils or markers or both.

4. Watercolors.

5. Acrylic paints and pad if you are interested in painting with acrylic.

The package includes:

3 day art intensive

3 months unlimited email support

One personal Consolation on art or "reinvading life" topic.

Cost is $299

Write to me at [masked] or call me (347)[masked] or just message me here. Namaste!
results.name: PYB with Vedic Art Principles Intensive

results.description:
http://www.nyhistory.org/programs/dr-strangelove-1964


"Pay-as-you-wish"  "Entrance to the film series is included with Museum Admission during New-York Historical’s Pay-as-you-wish Friday Nights (6–8 pm)...Tickets are distributed on a first-come, first-served basis beginning at 6 pm. New-York Historical Society members receive priority."

https://youtu.be/6T2uBeiNXAo

Dr. Strangelove (1964)

Bernard and Irene Schwartz Classic Film Series 

FEATURING: Ric Burns Fri, January 29th, 2016 | 7:00 pm   

EVENT DETAILS

Justice in Film 
Join us for the New-York Historical Society’s film series, featuring opening remarks by notable directors, writers, actors, and historians. This series explores how film has tackled social conflict, morality, and the perennial struggles between right and wrong that are waged from the highest levels of government to the smallest local communities.

Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964) 
When a rogue general launches a nuclear attack on the U.S.S.R., the president and his war team must scramble to prevent doomsday. Join us for Stanley Kubrick’s iconic dark comedy that satirizes the pervasive anxieties of Cold War America. Directed by Stanley Kubrick. Starring Peter Sellers, George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden. 93 min.

REMARKS

Ric Burns is the writer and director of numerous historical documentaries and is the founder of Steeplechase Films, an award-winning production company that has become one of PBS’s most trusted collaborators. 

TICKETS

Entrance to the film series is included with Museum Admission during New-York Historical’s Pay-as-you-wish Friday Nights (6–8 pm). No advanced reservations. Tickets are distributed on a first-come, first-served basis beginning at 6 pm. New-York Historical Society members receive priority.

LOCATION

The Robert H. Smith Auditorium at the New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024
results.name: "Dr. Strangelove" at the NY Historical Society.  Film and Talk-About. Host: Yen

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

 All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you'll get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.
results.how_to_find_us: Go downstairs to the basement at 6pm (go to the back of the bar and go down the stairs)

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

results.description:
Love art, hate art or just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because this event is more about socializing and having fun!  It is a great way to spend a Friday evening with dozens of other fun members and friends!

You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, take picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at The Old Castle Tavern for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).  At least One person in your group will need to have a camera.

Can I come alone?  YES! 95% of those attending will come on their own.  If you come alone we will randomly set you up on a team.

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle tavern for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

Her is how it works:  Arrive at Old Castle Tavern between 6pm-6:30pm, enjoy a cocktail and get set up on a team (if you already don't have one)  Once you have a complete team we will send you out to the museum to find all the clues.

What am I looking for at the museum?  All the clues are things that are already at the museum.  It is in the paintings, sculptures, gift shops, hallways, signs and the people that are there! Each team will have 75 minutes to find as many clues as possible.  The teams with the most points will win prizes.  Don't worry if you didn't answer all the items because there are bonus points.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time


Cost $15 general admission Please bring exact change

What's included?
- Admission to MOMA
-Private reception with drink Specials at the bar
- A fun way to visit the museum
- A unique way to make friends

Meeting info:

Hi Guys,

Thanks for signing up for The MOMA Scavenger Hunt.  Please come to The Old Castle Tavern at 160 West 54th. check in between 6pm-6:30pm.  We will be in the 2nd floor bar area. We will have signs directing you to the check in.  If you come later than 6:30 I can not guarantee that we can get you on a team.   If you get lost call me at[masked]-1098.

Come closer to 6pm if you wish to eat although most people wait until the hunt is over and eat together.

Please bring cash

Thanks

Dave
results.name: The Great Museum of Modern Art Scavenger Hunt and Cocktails

results.description:
Note: 

This is a German Movie Night presented by Goethe Institut. 

It is a public event, there is no specific area for our group.

The language of the movie is GERMAN, but it will have ENGLISH SUBTITLES. 

Auf der anderen Seite (2007 - 120min.) - directed by Faith Akin

The lives of six strangers get connected when a prostitute dies in a tragic accident, entailing questions of immigration, identity, transformation and death in this balladic film.

Is there a Cover charge?

No, the event is free.

Do I have to speak German to attend?

No. Just keep in mind that this movie is shown in German, with English subtitles.

How do I get there by subway?

4/5/6 & N/Q/R: Union Square - 2 Blocks away

L: 3rd Avenue or Union Square - 2 Blocks away

1/2/3 & A/C/E & F/M: Transfer to L at 14th Street

To contact Goethe Institut directly about this event, you can call them at[masked] or send an e-mail to [masked] 

Please enjoy the event, and as always, please update your RSVP if your plans change, it is highly appreciated and helps more than you may think.


Thomas

[masked]

[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in through the library to check in. There is no specific area for us, it is a public event. Get there early, the seating is on a first-come-first-serve basis.
results.name: Free German Movie Night @ Goethe Institut: "Auf der anderen Seite"

Get tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/findvalentine.html


Valentine's Day is rapidly approaching... Wouldn't it be great to be dating someone special by then! We set up our "Find Your Valentine" Singles Mixer so that by Valentine's Day you'll be going out for a romantic dinner and enjoying the excitement that comes with being with someone new and special... Instead of sitting home alone (that's no fun).

We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like weeding through questionable online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. We provide the perfect, relaxed environment to mingle with other single professionals.

THIS IS A MULTI MEETUP GROUP EVENT (ALSO A LOT OF SINGLES FROM OUTSIDE OF MEETUP WILL BE ATTENDING). THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS A VERY SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING!

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7:00 to 8:00!
* Find Your Matching Cupid Icebreaker With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Suggested Age Range: 20s, 30s & 40s

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

Get tickets here: http://www.ClickMixers.com/findvalentine.html

(If coming in from a distance, it's ok if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: PRANNA LOUNGE
(IN THE BEAUTIFUL UPSTAIRS MAIN BAR - 79 MADISON AVENUE)

Let's meet up, hang out and network with other like-minded folks over drinks at a fun bar, Maru, in K-Town!  They have drink specials ($20 for 5 bottled beers + wings which can be shared, or $20 for a 1 hour open bar) or 2 for 1 cocktails and the like.

Enter the entrance which says "Maru" and go up to the bar on the 3rd floor.
results.name: Happy Hour!

results.description:
Get tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/findvalentine.html


Valentine's Day is rapidly approaching... Wouldn't it be great to be dating someone special by then! We set up our "Find Your Valentine" Singles Mixer so that by Valentine's Day you'll be going out for a romantic dinner and enjoying the excitement that comes with being with someone new and special... Instead of sitting home alone (that's no fun).

We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like weeding through questionable online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. We provide the perfect, relaxed environment to mingle with other single professionals.

THIS IS A MULTI MEETUP GROUP EVENT (ALSO A LOT OF SINGLES FROM OUTSIDE OF MEETUP WILL BE ATTENDING). THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS A VERY SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING!

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7:00 to 8:00!
* Find Your Matching Cupid Icebreaker With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Suggested Age Range: 20s, 30s & 40s

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20 (This price will be going up as event approaches so we recommend getting your tickets now)
Get tickets here: http://www.ClickMixers.com/findvalentine.html

WHEN: FRIDAY, JANUARY 29th, 2016, 6:30-10:30
(If coming in from a distance, it's ok if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: PRANNA LOUNGE
(IN THE BEAUTIFUL UPSTAIRS MAIN BAR - 79 MADISON AVENUE)
results.name: Find Your Valentine Singles Mixer (Prizes, Light Appetizers & More)!

group.name: Fun & Exciting Things To Do In NYC

We get it...You want to meet someone but don't feel like weeding through questionable online dating profiles. Prepay Only Event. Tickets NOT sold at door.

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers (7-8pm) 

• Drink Specials

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• 100+ singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s+ 

• Ice Breakers & Prizes 

*MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE ($20) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/findvalentine/

*Price goes up to $30 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. 

• As date gets closer, we may shut down tix for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced.  Get tix ASAP to secure your spot, especially women.

• Typically 75% of attendees come alone (25% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts) 

• MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. 100+ SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

PREPAY ONLY HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/findvalentine/
results.name: Find Your Valentine Singles Mixer (SOLD OUT FOR MEN!) PREPAY ONLY

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
It doesn't matter if you've played pool before or not. This is just a fun way to make new friends and maybe find that someone special. 

Mix & mingle before playing pool with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

This event will sell out quickly (especially for MEN) so get your tickets ASAP:

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1TlHOem 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1ZuM6Ug 

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool or for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game wins a prize.  

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next  table and the process begins again. We will continue for two hours or until you have met everyone. 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

What's included:

• Free Pool Games, & Scorecard Matching  

•  Ice Breakers 

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Prizes for winning team

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.  

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1TlHOem

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1ZuM6Ug

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+. Food and drink will be available for purchase.

How do I attend?  RSVP w/ group and purchase a ticket in advance at these links (no tix sold at door) -

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1TlHOem 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1ZuM6Ug
results.name: Singles Pool Night - PREPAY ONLY EVENT

results.description:
Prepayment @ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5974 is required 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed POOL (BILLIARDS) for Singles 

WHERE: Society Billiards & bar 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of two or three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have someone to sign up with. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle  and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool OR play for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game will win a prize. 


At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next pool table and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.


Prepayment @ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5974 is required


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


30-$35 depending on how early you register.
results.name: Speed POOL (Billiards)- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

Join us for another fun shoot with Russian models Stacy and Maria.
Both gorgeous models, 5'11" with brown hair, so I wanted to make a string of shoots called "Twins" where I place 2 models that look alike.

This will be an Implied Nude shoot using Faux Fur fabrics and Leather Vests. Possibly using Denim Jacket/Vests as well.

STACY



MARIA

1 section for Continuous Lighting
1 section for Private Shoot (1-1) w/ Strobe Lighting or your own Lights ($20/10-15 mins)

I will provide makeup and clothing as usual.
Will have technical support from Mr. Lin and Rudy, and model direction from Mr. Lylez as always.

PAYMENT:
$100  EARLY BIRDS (from Jan 22 - Jan 25)
$140  2nd Round of Admission (from Jan 26 - 29)
$200  AT THE DOOR ADMISSION

results.description:
Join us for this class on HTML and CSS aimed at beginners with no or little experience in programming. This class provides a full introduction to the building block of every website, HTML (the content of a site) and CSS (used to style websites including colors and fonts). In this class, you will leave with the ability to create a basic web page and an understanding of the fundamentals of programming.

 Key Takeaways:
• General overview of programming
• Learn basic techniques and concepts used for website development
• Learn how HTML and CSS work together to create richer online experiences
• Create a basic one-page website with images, content, custom fonts and colors
• We’ll provide you with available resources if you’d like to continue learning 


Prerequisites and Preparation: 


Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook).
Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the home page).
Light snacks will be provided.


*This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in our immersive program.
results.name: HTML and CSS for Beginners

results.description:
Event Type: Museum

Admission: Free

Description:

The Museum at FIT, accredited by the American Alliance of Museums, is one of a select group of specialized fashion museums, including the Muse de la Mode, the Mode Museum, and the Museo de la Moda. For the 100,000 people who visit The Museum at FIT each year, the museum works to create exhibitions, programs, and publications that are both entertaining and educational. The mission of the Museum is to advance knowledge of fashion through exhibitions, programs and publications. Founded in 1969, the Museum was installed in the current building in 1974, and exhibitions began to be presented in 1975.

Current Exhibition:

• Denim: Fashion's Frontier

Denim has become one of the world's most beloved fabrics. According to anthropologist Daniel Miller, "On any given day, nearly half the worlds population is in jeans." The cultural significance of this has yet to be fully determined. Denim: Fashion's Frontier explores the dynamic history of denim and its relationship with high fashion from the 19th century to the present. The exhibition traces denim from its origins in work wear of the 19th century, through its role as a symbol of counterculture rebellion in America, to its acceptance into mainstream culture. It culminates with the arrival of blue jeans as luxury items during the late 20th century, and denim's subsequent deconstruction by contemporary designers through postmodern pastiche and experimentation.

Alongside this chronology, Denim: Fashion's Frontier highlights important points of engagement between high fashion and denim that are often left out of typical denim histories. Themes addressed include the role of advertising in creating popular mythologies, as well as issues of distressing, connoisseurship, and environmental concerns. The goal is to shed new light on one of the worlds most popular types of clothing, and to explore how a particular style of woven cotton has come to dominate the clothing industry.

Reference Links:

http://www.fitnyc.edu/museum/

http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-museum-new-york

DISCLAIMER:
When you RSVP "Yes" to an event, or participate in an event, please understand that you are responsible for your own safety and well-being, and will hold no one else liable in case of personal injury or any mishap. You agree not to hold the meetup group's organizer, assistant organizers, event organizers, hosts, or any other group members responsible for any injuries or issues that may occur at any time before, during or after an event. You are personally responsible for obtaining essential information about an event, making necessary preparations for participating in the event, and ensuring your own safety and well-being. Your RSVP of "Yes" on the event page or attendance of an event signifies your full understanding and acceptance of the terms of this liability waiver. We reserve the rights to limit this event to physically fit people.

END
results.name: Denim: Fashion's Frontier @ The Museum at FIT (Free Admission)

results.description:
Happy new year, all! After a trying holiday season, I am back! The place that we'll be kicking 2016 at has actually been around for over a century, so it's a real treat. One of the dishes, Tuscan Ragu has been featured on the Food Network show, "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives." Not sure why this place was featured on that show as it doesn't fit into any of those categories, but I can attest that the dish is good. Here's some info:

       http://johnsof12thstreet.com/

As always, please do not RSVP unless you are certain you can make it. If you RSVP and cannot go, PLEASE change your RSVP so that others who may wish to go can do so as there are times we have long waiting lists. Everyone will be responsible for their own expenses. 

Hope to see you there!

EVENT DETAILS

Justice in Film
Join us for the New-York Historical Society’s film series, featuring opening remarks by notable directors, writers, actors, and historians. This series explores how film has tackled social conflict, morality, and the perennial struggles between right and wrong that are waged from the highest levels of government to the smallest local communities.

Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)
When a rogue general launches a nuclear attack on the U.S.S.R., the president and his war team must scramble to prevent doomsday. Join us for Stanley Kubrick’s iconic dark comedy that satirizes the pervasive anxieties of Cold War America. Directed by Stanley Kubrick. Starring Peter Sellers, George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden. 93 min.

REMARKS

Ric Burns is the writer and director of numerous historical documentaries and is the founder of Steeplechase Films, an award-winning production company that has become one of PBS’s most trusted collaborators. 

TICKETS

Entrance to the film series is included with Museum Admission during New-York Historical’s Pay-as-you-wish Friday Nights (6–8 pm). No advanced reservations. Tickets are distributed on a first-come, first-served basis beginning at 6 pm. New-York Historical Society members receive priority.

LOCATION

The Robert H. Smith Auditorium at the New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024

results.description:
The Things Network is a recent example of a decentralized, community-owned and built IoT data network. We're fortunate to have their Amsterdam-based founding team join us.


The technology uses LoRaWAN and allows for things to connect to the internet through low-cost gateways that can connect up to[masked] devices in a radius of 5km. It features low battery usage, long range, and low bandwidth, so is a great fit for sensor data.


Their manifesto states that the network is open. Any work created in the community will be open sourced. The Things Network is set up in a decentralized way to not have any single point of control or failure. Nothing is centralized or owned by the founders.  

The Things Network started only 6 months ago and is already active in more than 50 cities around the world. 

For more info, please see thethingsnetwork.org or read about the complete story here.


Agenda
7:00pm - Event opens, networking  
7:15pm - Announcements, topic & speaker intro by Linda Drabik
7:30pm - Introduction of The Things Network by Wienke Giezeman  
8:00pm - Workshop for creating a LoRaWAN use case by Johan Stokking  
8:30pm - Time to play around with LoRaWAN
results.name: IoT NY #28: A Decentralized, Open IoT- The Things Network

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions
results.name: Acting Class

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

The NY Shamanic Healing Circle meets about every last Friday of the month from 7 -9:30 pm

We open new doors for personal and communal healing. Experience and practice a vast range of healing modalities. As we work, we allow ourselves to be “seen and heard’ by Spirit. Bring your worries, illness and dis-ease into a Sacred Space and allow your healing to manifest.

Please bring a drum or rattle.
Have extra socks for warm cozy feet, and a blanket or shawl for comfort, water.

About Irma Caceres “StarSpirit Woman”

Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. Irma StarSpirit Woman currently lives in Queens, NY Contact her at [masked] or visit: shamanicfirereiki.com
