results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Bodhi Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!

results.description:
Have you instantly felt a connection to a person you just met?
Have places seemed familiar even though you have never have visited them?
Do you have a fear but have no known reason to feel that fear?

There is a way to explore relationships, unexplained fears, traumas, and find your life purpose. It can be done through past life regression in hypnosis. If you believe
in reincarnation and feel that a past life is affecting you in this lifetime then a past life regression may help you find the answers. Hypnosis is a natural altered state. In hypnosis you relax enough to go into the subconscious where the memories are stored. A hypnotist induces hypnosis and guides the client to a deep relaxed state. There is always a reason to go back to a past life. It can be to find your life purpose, heal, and fix relationships, un-block fears and so much more. People can experience past lives a little differently. For some it can be very vivid like a movie, others get flashes, some just sense or hear what is going on. You remember everything that goes on in the past life regression. Some people get names, places and time periods. The most important thing is to listen to the messages that come through in a past life regression. Trust that the subconscious takes you where you need to go to. Come to a group past life regression by Certified Clinical Hypnosis Practitioner Mary Battaglia. Mary has 500 hours of hypnosis training. She helps adults and teens with
weight loss, quit smoking, test anxiousness, public speaking. Sports hypnosis, medical hypnosis, births and past life regression. Mary helps people clear whatever
block is in their way. Mary’s practice Metro Hypnosis Center is located in Oradell New Jersey.

$39 prepay/ $45 at door
for more info @ Mary, check out her website:
www.metrohypnosiscenter.com/

TO PREPAY (and $ave):

PAYPAL ~ [masked]

or make out checks to "Rebalance" and send to 

rebalance 63 Jefferson Ave, Westwood NJ 07675


**Parking in back. Enter from back of long brick building through door that juts out with chandelier. When you enter go up the steps and the conference room is to the left.  Please feel free to bring a blanket b/c when we meditate and our bodies relax, our body temperature lowers.
results.name: Finding Life Purpose Through Past Life Regression

Winter is a time for drawing inward, for nurturing the seeds of our dreams so they can burst forth in a beautiful expansive way come springtime. It is at this time when outwardly everything seems utterly barren, that the seed is gaining it’s most vibrant strength, invisibly, beneath the soil. With crystal singing bowls, chimes, halo drums, and ethereal voice, Mirabai Moon and Karttikeya Arul will create a magical dream space and take you on a journey to the inner realms. We are excited to share this mystical, magical event with you!

This series explores how film has tackled social conflict, morality, and the perennial struggles between right and wrong that are waged from the highest levels of government to the smallest local communities.

Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb (1964)
When a rogue general launches a nuclear attack on the U.S.S.R., the president and his war team must scramble to prevent doomsday. Join us for Stanley Kubrick’s iconic dark comedy that satirizes the pervasive anxieties of Cold War America. Directed by Stanley Kubrick. Starring Peter Sellers, George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden. 93 min.

Price: Free with pay-as-you-wish Friday admission
results.name: Dr. Strangelove (1964)

results.description:
Over and over and over. We are on auto pilot now, so we will have this, or another event, at a place to be determined, (TBI), every two weeks, with a pancake or some other panic event tossed in to keep everyone aggravated to the fullest.

As usual, if you RSVP 'yes' but can't make it, call me; your merry group organizer, Greg, at[masked] 1066.

And the standard 'It's ok to come late, or bring well behaved young ones' is in effect as well. 

Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 12AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie. 

If we have a change of venue, for any given week, we will let you know in advance.
results.how_to_find_us: if in a panic, call my cell! 201 621 1066 ask for Greg.
results.name: Friday Veggie Heaven Bi weekly initiation.

group.name: Hackensack / Teaneck  Veggie Vegan Meetup Group

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place:


Eclectic gourmet small plates, high-end cocktails & music in a chic, upscale, 3-level space.

http://stantonsocial.com/

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: The Stanton Social - Tapas Bar

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)
results.name: On Going FRIDAY EVENING Yoga with Reiki (both men and women are in this class)

group.name: The Reiki & Yoga Meetup Group of Clifton New Jersey

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club and theres a full food menu.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Rob Magnotti (Comedy Central), Lenny Marcus (Comedy Central) , Vic Henley (HBO), Vlad Camaano (NBC), Drew Fraser (Comedy Central)

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!
results.name: Free admission to Friday Night Comedy Meetup at Dangerfield's

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


From the creators of Quiet Events comes a hilarious show where you get to eavesdrop on a couple’s first date! Not only will you be able to hear what they are saying…but what they are THINKING too! Boy Meets Girl is an interactive play where you get to tune into to the girl or guy’s inner thoughts using special Quiet Events headphones. With one push of the button, you choose whether to stick with one or swap between the two.

David and Katie both swiped right… so they must be perfect for each other, right? Go on their first date and find out. You’ll get a hilarious glimpse into what are guys and girls really thinking when they first meet.

Come early and enjoy dinner and drinks at the bar. You’ll also get to listen into what the actors are thinking about before their big date.

Showtime details: 
Location: Hudson Station – 440 9th Ave, NY, NY (Btw, 34 & 35th) 
Dates: Jan 29th & Feb 12th 
Show begins promptly at 7:30pm-9:30pm

More Details 
– Tickets are limited 
– Possible sexual & vulgar content 
– Price includes 1 FREE ticket to Quiet Clubbing Party ($25 Value) 
– Credit required for headphone rental (1 card per group) 
– Kitchen & Bar opens at 4pm 
– From 4-6pm Show your ticket and get 2 for 1 drinks!

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to the two actors with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows who you are listening to. You’ll be seated at at table, you can order food & drinks to enjoy the show. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones else there will be a $100 charge.

THE PEOPLE WHO MAKE IT AMAZING

david
DAVID CARL (David): Originally from Dallas, TX, David has been working as an actor in New York since 2006. You may have caught him in the Awesome 80s Prom, Point Break LIVE!, Gary Busey’s One-Man Hamlet, or various productions with Project Y and Slant Theatre. Gary Busey Hamlet received an award for “Overall Excellence in Solo Performance” and an extension at Fringe NYC 2014. In 2015 David and his team took the show to Florida, Colorado and Edinburgh Fringe.

You might have seen him on Guiding Light, All My Children,or heard his voice on the radio, TV or internet hawking fast foods, banks, and gas. He also performs improv every week at the PIT with Skycopter, where he recently co-wrote, and performed David and Katie Get Re-Married with Katie Hartman. David has a BFA from the University of Evansville and an MFA from Rutgers.

Sashe- SASHA EDEN (Katie’s Thoughts): is an Actor and Producer; she is the recipient of The Harlequin More Than Words Award for being a “real life heroine” and was selected by The UTNE Reader as one of the 25 Visionaries Who Are Changing Your World. She graduated from Vassar College. As an Actor, Sasha’s work has been featured on stage, television and film.

Katie- KATIE HARTMAN (Katie): writes and performs as one half of the acclaimed NYC sketch comedy duo Skinny Bitch Jesus Meeting (Edinburgh Fringe, NYC Fringe, Austin Sketchfest, Women in Comedy Festival, Charleston Comedy Festival, etc.). SBJM was recently named “one of the twenty-five funny people that should have their own TV show” by Complex Magazine. She is co-creator/co-star of the web series “Made To Order” (madetoorderseries.com) which was recently was listed as one of “6 Brilliant Web Series” by Marie Claire. Katie can be seen on the popular web series’ “High Maintenance” and with regularity on the Webby-winning YouTube channel “Barely Political.” Last fall she performed in the seasonal off-off Broadway monologue play The Pumpkin Pie Show: Seasick and is a rotating cast member in the Off-Broadway production ofFlanagan’s Wake,an interactive, half-improvised play, Katie improvises weekly with PIT House teams Gypsy Danger and Big Black Car

Robert- CHRIS ROBERTI (David’s Thoughts): is an actor and writer who lives in Brooklyn. He performs weekly at the PIT and is a founder of Bankrukt Productions. chrisroberti.com bankrukt.com

THE CREATIVE TEAM

Marlo- MARLO HUNTER (Director): Director/Choreographer & Callaway Award winner for Unlock’d (The Duke – Prospect). Select as Director/Choreographer: My Life Is A Musical (Lab at The Duke, Bay Street), Date Of A Lifetime (NJ Rep), Island Song (BPP); as Choreographer: LMNOP (TUTS); Lips Together, Teeth Apart (Second Stage). Founder, Eating Their Words: directed new plays by Annie Baker, Neil LaBute, Douglas Carter Beane, Theresa Rebeck, Amy Herzog. Co-Creator, Director: The Theatrical Culinary Project w/Chef Carla Hall. UPCOMING: Director/Choreographer – Island Song(Adirondack Theatre Festival). B.A., Princeton. www.MarloHunter.com

Rainey- RAINEY ROWAN (Producing Assistant): Rainey Rowan has coordinated and produced with companies such as Slant Theater, Frames Lounge, Eating Their Words, and Theatrical Culinary Project. She’s excited to be working again with Marlo Hunter and Sasha Eden on this ‘Quiet’ venture. Rainey is an operations manager at the premier dance studio Steps on Broadway, and continues to dance, sing, and act in her rare moments of free time.

Will- WILL PETZ (Producer & Innovator): Social Party Expert since 2001, Will has hosted unique events throughout NYC and produced hundreds of themed parties including Quiet Clubbing parties with offices in NY, LA, SF, and Austin. Quiet Theater is another visionary event that Will is excited to expand on in 2016
results.name: 2 for 1 drinks, 1 Free Quiet Clubbing Party Ticket, And A Play!

results.description:
Update: Hi everyone. Snow tubing tickets are sold out on Campgaw's website for tonight. Maybe the group can go again another night if more members would like to go. For those attending, please print out and fill out your waiver form:

http://media.wix.com/ugd/7c17f8_754034e715d445e2813b2f2da00c3c90.pdf

Update:

Hi everyone. Hope you are all safe and well with this winter storm we just had. Now that it's cold and snowy, I think we will be able to go snow tubing in Mahwah.


Please buy your ticket for tubing in advance from the website.
Go to this link:
https://ssl3.connectintouch.com/wp.dll?Axis/campgaw

Click "Tubing". On the next page, click "Add to Cart". Click the box for the Friday January 29 session at 8-10PM. Then click "Edit Your Cart and Checkout"

The website will ask you to create an account and you can pay for your ticket.
Please ask any questions you may have in the comments section.

Hello now that winter is here its time for winter sports Check out this family-fun-loving, adventure that’s close to home! It’s fun, it’s easy, and it’s better than sledding any day! Imagine the thrill of riding down a snowy hill and then effortlessly riding your tube back up. Tubes are provided and a surface lift is available for you to ride up the hill. Choose between different runs with varied levels of rollers and pitch. No experience or special equipment is needed. Just hop in your tube and enjoy the ride.


Note:

•Only 140 tickets are sold for each session.


•Sessions sell out quickly and online purchasing is recommended.


•Wednesday: Tickets go on sale for Saturday and Sunday.


•Saturday: Tickets go on sale for Monday - Friday


•Tubing may be limited during certain sessions due to large groups.

Safety Requirements for Tubing Guests:

•Proper footwear required.


•NO ski boots permitted.


•One person per tube.


•All riders must ride on their stomach. •Minimum height of 42”


•Maximum weight of 300 lbs.


•Anyone under 42" will NOT be permitted on the tubing hill and NO refunds will be given.

For the safety of the participants, tubing may be closed for up to 15 minutes, during any session, for grooming as requested by Ski Patrol or Mountain Management.

Tubing tickets are NOT refundable or exchangeable unless we are not open for the specific session purchased. Tickets for missed sessions are NOT refundable. Based on weather - tubing may be slow. No refunds will be given.

All participants must sign a waiver or the waiver must be signed by a parent or guardian for all minors. The waiver must be turned in to receive your tickets. Tickets will not be issued without a signed waiver and no refunds will be given.


Mountain website: http://www.skicampgaw.com/tubing#!tubing/c24vq

Tubing Release form must be filled out and brought with you:
http://media.wix.com/ugd/7c17f8_7ff296088ff0477b970a7d3322017dac.pdf

results.description:
Winter is finally here, it's getting sooo cold, what we needed is hotpot on a freezing winter night! On the coming Friday, we are going to visit Hometown Hotpot - a very popular all-you-can-eat hotpot place in Chinatown. They have a wide selection of soup base and over 50 meat, seafood, vegetable items! 

It is conveniently located in Chinatown. Nearby transits are: J train - Bowery; 4 & 6 train - Canal; and, B & D train - Grand. 

• Serious RSVP only, please. Do not RSVP if you're not certain. 

• "NO-SHOW" or Last day RSVP change Will NOT be tolerated. 

• There will be a $3.00 meetup fee and will be added to your bill. 

• Cash Only. Please bring small bills. Makes everyone's life easier :) 

• Feel free to bring friends to join this event! If you are bringing non-members, please make sure they understand the rules stated above. 

• Please do not RSVP if you do not agree to all points above. 

Stay warm!

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Friday Night? This event Friday night is for men and women at The Darbar Grille.  

At present we need women and mainly women (aged 25 to 35)  although there's a little flexibility in the age range. Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.  The theme Friday night is diverse, multi-racial and international singles.

Grab friends and come along to Darbar Grille to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance. Also tickets are free for a limited time.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me

(i.e. from <a>[masked]</a>). If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

regards, Daniel

results.description:
Friday nights under the lights! Teams are 7v7, it's a  60min + game and coed friendly.


Pls aim to arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Emphasis on passing over dribbling.


4) If there are no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP w/ payment. This goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club and theres a full food menu.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Rob Magnotti (Comedy Central), Lenny Marcus (Comedy Central) , Vic Henley (HBO), Vlad Camaano (NBC), Drew Fraser (Comedy Central)

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

The Rebel Alliance has recruited a team of rogues, misfits and ne'er do wells to infiltrate the criminal underworld of Nar Shadaa! Join the notorious Black Crows gang and assist the Rebels in undermining the influence of the Galactic Empire in the underworld of Nar Shadaa, the smuggler's moon.

This is a Star Wars: Age of Rebellion game that takes place on Nar Shadaa in Hutt Space. PCs are agents of the Rebel Alliance who pose as smugglers, bounty hunters and other scum while carrying out the agenda to free the galaxy of the Empire. Force Users are also welcome, as the ancient practices of the Jedi and other Force sects are the highest crimes that the Empire have decreed.

Character types from all three of the Fantasy Flight Star Wars games (Edge of the Empire, Age of Rebellion, Force and Destiny) are allowed, and the special FFG dice are provided. New players will be shown how to play this great game, so beginners are welcome.

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ.


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Close Embrace) w/ Adriana andShawn
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics ("All The Jookin' ") w/ John
9:30pm-1:30am - LIVE MUSIC!! w/ The Robert Ross Band / DJ Reed spinning during band breaks

****************************************************************************


JANUARY EXTENDED TOPICS:

"That's My Jam!"
Everyone has something they just love. That move, that song, that style that they just can’t stop doing! Come join us for a month of classes - each taught by a different instructor - to learn what inspires them. Use their inspiration to help fuel yours!

This Week: "All The Jookin' " 
Whether it was in jook joints in the country or rent parties in the city, dancers were jookin' to the blues. We'll teach you the vocabulary and movement you need for when the lights are low and the music is slow. The focus will be on close embrace, partnered solo movement, and textures like intensity and emotion.


Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

A Note From Melissa: "Blues is incredibly important to me. Not just the dance itself, but the way it's inspired me and given me confidence, the way I've grown more aware of my body and the way it moves and works, and most of all, the community and the people that it's brought into my life.

This weekend is my 34th birthday, and I want nothing more than to celebrate it with all of your beautiful, smiling faces. I plan to spend the night dancing with the community that has brought me so much joy since I first discovered it several years ago. I'd be honored if you'd join me."
****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 30 to 80 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $16 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $24 for the night!

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.facebook.com/BluesDanceNewYork/events
results.name: Friday Night Blues NYC

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet @ La Fama. We are here every Friday for those who like to take a beginner introductory Salsa class at no extra charge are more than welcome. This is at a spacious boutique dance studio in Times Square. Let's do it!

Admission: $10 to get in. Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class:  Starts at 9:30pm. This is an introductory class I give at no extra charge to you. You just pay for the practice party and the class is complimentary. Although it only teaches the basic step, it prepares you for the Level 1 class well and gives you a taste of salsa dancing. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics, A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details,  check its event page:

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/

Also, join our facebook group for updates, class videos, tips, music, chat with other students, and more

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.

results.description:
What happens when today’s leading political figures are forced to share a stage in front of a live audience with no moderator, no rules, and no limits to their insanity?

Phoenix Theatre Ensemble will be presenting the world premiere of the company’s newly commissioned work by writer, actor and performer Al Pagano titled "Filibusted' a curated selection of the verbatim recorded writings, musings and comments of U.S. Presidential candidates and other political public figures. Pagano is a classically trained stage actor, writer and has a burgeoning career in stand-up comedy. Performing with Mr. Pagano will be actress Amy Loughead.

Filibusted shares much in common with today’s nationally televised debates, in that it’s full of shi—uh, improvisation. It covers today’s most crucial (and comical) topics. Plus, it features a middle-aged white dude who talks a lot. Some would call it the American dream…we call it an outrageous night of theatre!

Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.”
Discount tickets for New York Theatre Under $25 Meetup @ $16 each (which includes a complimentary beer, wine or soft drink!). Use the code “Meet3” when ordering your tickets either by phone at[masked] or online at https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10016145
Show starts at 10:00 PM – arrive in lobby of theatre by 9:45 enjoy a beer or wine at concession. Running time is approximately 60 minutes. You'll have a great time.
results.name: Politicos' unintended humor "FILIBUSTED"­ all in their own words

Renegade Hardware stand as leaders in the drum n bass movement. Founded in 1995 by Clayton Hines and Mark Hill, the label set out to support the darker more cutting edge sound of rolling militant drum n bass. results.description:
Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
results.how_to_find_us: Bubble Directions: Hofstra soccer bubble! Use Hofstra Blvd from Hempstead Tpke....from security booth, turn right after 2nd stop sign towards the athletic fields.  Drive all the way down until u c d dome on your right!!

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend!

 Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee!  Please also note that if only one person attends (in addition to Eve), the meeting will last one hour instead of 1.5.

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone
results.name: Let's talk!

results.description: 世界日報將於春節前的黃金雙休日，舉辦大型「年貨展銷會」，參展攤商內容豐富，包括年節食品、年節禮品贈品、飯店及年菜、農產品、服飾、旅遊休閒、銀行理財及保險等，讓大家辦年貨一次購足，快快樂樂迎接猴年。世界日報年貨展銷會將於1月30日(周六)、1月31日(周日)連續兩天，上午11時至下午5時，在法拉盛喜來登酒店舉行。現場還有祥獅獻瑞、揮毫寫春聯，以及現代舞、電子琴演奏、小提琴演奏、女聲演唱、民俗舞等。好禮大抽獎是一定不能少的，兩天的活動每天每個時段都有抽獎，獎品豐富，另有貼心來展禮。中國信託銀行是這次年貨展銷會贊助商，目前參展商家有：蜂蜜園、海魁鮑魚、COWAY、Volare 皮草、美國愛德華集團、海狼科技、奇有臘味、Jessica Fan 明星顏面設計師、美國無限藥業、紐約人壽法拉盛分行、緬甸玉器廠、大富行白蘭氏、蘇記中日餐、錦山紅參、華隆公司、海爾家電、太子行、METROPLUS、正官庄、裕威參行、滋補城海味中藥行、紐約人壽、Seafood Associates Corp.等。年貨展銷會優惠有：蜂蜜園所有貨品一律九折優惠、大富行提供白蘭氏不同的雞精產品特價；華隆公司提供產品"白家陳記阿寬四川鋪蓋麵"試吃；太子行提供全球No.1泡麵MyKuali泡麵買一袋(4包裝)送白咖哩麵1包，送完為止；太子行提供太子牌威州花旗參威州小長泡參(4oz)特價$100/3包；太子行提供純正花旗參蜜糖茶原價$21特價$19?；美國愛德華集團新春回饋大促銷，活動當天正點時間送禮物。活動當天還有更多商家提供優惠特賣，敬請期待。另外，為服務讀者與商家，世界日報將於1月23日出版「年節特刊」，隨當日世界日報紐約版隨報發行。「年節特刊」以新年年節消費趨勢為主題，將以夾報的形式呈現多元化的年貨採辦渠道，利用報紙通路宣傳。商家擴大影響力和知名度的平台，也是讀者了解更多年節信息。年貨展銷會的時間是1月30日和1月31日上午11時至下午5時，地點在法拉盛39大道135-20號喜來登酒店2樓宴會廳，免費入場，歡迎民眾踴躍參加。抽獎券需現場填妥後，投入抽獎箱，方可參加抽獎。有關攤位徵展及特刊廣告洽詢電話：[masked]轉分機6345。

results.description:
Sat. Jan. 30.  Wyanokies / Norvin Green State Park:  A lollipop  / loop  in the  Snow  : 1 E 4

MEANINGFUL SNOW HAS FALLEN: LETs PLAY ( if you have any doubts or concern what this mean please contact)  event is : a slow: <4 miles: snowshoes or snow slog.  We will find unbroken snow, and GO !  Each in turn will break trail with intent to find the roughed landforms and great views in the compact basin behind what was Weiss Ecology center: forever accepting the forest open and dense and our own follies in the snow.  Expect 1000 feet elevation gain.  Strenuous: difficult.  Expect steeps, tangled forest, views, snow drifts. Bring snowshoes if you have them, we will dip stick the snow to determine if enough depth left to use them. Those without are welcome: BUT YOU believe your energy and grit are match to the snow challenge.  Check your favorite weather source. Dress in non cotton layers you can take on and off to stay warm and unsweated. Gadders are a must to keep snow out of boots.  At  least 1 qt water: high energy easy to eat foods. Winter stops / breaks  are short.  Tranporation:  # 3

take 7:30 a.m. NJ TRANSIT Bus # 197  [masked],[masked]  www.njtransit.com ) . Bus departs from PABT Gate 233.   Arrives 8:43  remind the driver to stop  at Rt 511 & Skyline Lake Dr. : there is a  Diner on the NE corner.  Drivers parking in the small shopping mall, behind the Dinner.  L: Bill Hladky  914. 874. 4640 [masked]     I offer three space for three riders.  We will arrange pick up location.  Return drop off will be in Manhattan

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
Registration is now closed for this event.  If interested, we need course volunteers.  Please contact Joe at [masked]

INTRODUCTION

Registration closes 1/10/16

718 Cyclery announces "Fat and Frozen", NYC's first fatbike race. The race will happen on Saturday, January 23rd 2016 at Cunningham Park in Queens NYC. The goal of this event is to raise awareness of large tire off-road riding, as will as showcase the work of CLIMB (Concerned Long Island Mountain Bikers). Registration is required here (please dont register through this Meetup), and beginners are welcome. We anticipate many entries, so please register soon. We will have a fleet of demo fatbikes for test rides and racing!

FATBIKE DEFINITIONS
26+: 26" rims, width >35mm, typically 50mm. Tire widths typically >2.5", e.g. 2.8", 3.0".
27.5+/650+: 27.5" rims, width >35mm, typically 50mm. Tire width typically >2.5", e.g. 2.7"-3,.5".
29+: 29" rims, width >35mm. Tire width typically up to 3.0".
XL: 26" rims, width 60mm-103mm. Tires widths typically >3.5", e.g. 3.8", 4.5", 4.8".
2XL: 26" rims, width[masked]mm. Tire width >5.0".
(From wikipedia.com)

REGISTRATION FEE
Here's how it works:

• CLIMB (Concerned Mountain Bikers of Long Island) Membnersrace for free. Join here

• Or, make a $25 donation to CLIMB (Payment due day of race)

• Or, make a promise to donate 4 hours on a local CLIMB trail crew.

RACE FORMAT AND NOTES
Helmets and brakes required
We will need to be extremely sensitive to ground conditions, monitoring ground moisture and temperature swings. CLINIC AND PRE-RIDE
For those new to fat-biking, we will be holding a clinic and a race course pre-ride to get people familiar. More details to follow.

Registration is required here (please dont register through this Meetup)
results.name: 2016 "Fat and Frozen" Fatbike Race (Registration Closed)

results.description:
Hello everyone, 

For those of you I haven't yet had the pleasure of meeting, my name is Maor, and I'm CSNYC's new Community Manager (not to worry, Cindy is still very much involved in the happenings here!). 

We're pleased to announce our first CS Pedagogy Meetup of 2016, and we have a great group of presenters lined up to kick off the year! Read on to learn more.

Presentations will begin promptly at 9:45am, so PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME and remember to bring a photo ID for entry to the building. Bring a laptop as well, if possible.

Also, please save the date for our next Pedagogy Meetup on March 19, 2016.

If you're interested in speaking at one of our future Pedagogy Meetups, please fill out this presenter form.

> Jonathan Schor - CodeMonkey: Write Code, Catch Bananas, Save the World!

CodeMonkey is an award-winning online game that teaches text-based programming in a real world programming language called CoffeeScript. Accompanied by full lesson plans and a teacher dashboard, it was designed for giving coding classes in middle and elementary schools by any teacher. No training or prior computer science knowledge required! In this workshop Jonathan will present how CodeMonkey’s free version can be used in classrooms to give an introduction to text-based coding, and how its full curriculum can guide students from the first steps in coding into creating their own original HTML5 games. All this through an intuitive, social and highly engaging game experience.

Jonathan is co-founder and CEO of CodeMonkey Studios.


> Ashok Basawapatna - Scalable Game Design: A Three-Step Strategy Exposing Students to Computational Thinking

This presentation will introduce teachers to a three-step strategy for engaging students in computational thinking through game creation.The first step involves empowering novice students with the ability to create their first 3D game in 5 hours of class-time. As students construct this first project, they are exposed to important programming building blocks called Computational Thinking Patterns. Once students learn these patterns, they will reuse and build upon them to create subsequent games and simulations. The second step employs a gentle-slope of increasingly complex challenges to keep students in the Flow. The third step involves validated methods for actually assessing the computational thinking skills students have gained.


Ashok is Assistant Professor at SUNY College at Old Westbury.

> Leigh Ann DeLyser - Using Multiple Exit Points for Differentiation

NYC public schools are challenging because classrooms contain vastly diverse groups of students. Encouraging engagement and preparing lessons at the appropriate difficulty for all students can be extraordinarily challenging. Through this session, Leigh Ann will present pedagogical and assessment practices that can help effectively engage all learners, without requiring teachers to create completely different assignments for each student. The multiple exit point strategy helps teachers value not only low-level skills, but also creative thinking and higher levels of Bloom's Taxonomy.


Leigh Ann is Director of Education and Research at CSNYC.

> Sean Pawelec & Matt Boyle - #CS4All: What It's Like to Teach in NYCDOE Computer Science Programs

Sean and Matt from the Renaissance School in East Harlem will talk about their experiences in NYC DOE computer science programs through the lens of a lesson. They will walk you through a lesson from the Beauty and Joy of Computing (BJC) AP Computer Science Principles curriculum, which they are piloting with a cohort of teachers this year. The lesson will cover how conditional can be used to generatively create computer graphics. Sean and Matt will use the Snap! programming language used in the BJC course and fundamentals of computational thinking mixed with an artistic approach drawn from their backgrounds to drive the lessons. Sean and Matt will also talk about professional development, curricular and material support, and community experiences with the DOE for the BJC course. DOE staff will be on hand to answer detailed questions and discuss with teachers interested in applying for the new cohorts.


Sean and Matt are AP Computer Science teachers at the Renaissance Charter High School for Innovation.
results.name: CS Pedagogy Meetup - Jan 2016 Edition

results.description:
THIS IS A SNOW HIKE

Durable Hiking Boot Ice Traction Devices Are REQUIRED

YakTrax, Ice Trekkers, MicroSpikes

NO SPIKY, NO HIKEY!

Extra Socks Recommended


_________________________-

Hike Rating and Specs: P2+/T3-5/E3K/D10M/H6

P2+ = Hike Pace: 2+ MPH Avg

T3-5 = Terrain: 3 = Dirt Trails 5 = Snow/Ice

E3K = Elevation Gain: 3,000 Feet (Vertical)

D10 = Distance: 10+ Miles

H6 = Hours/Total Hike Time: 6 Hours (10-4PM)

______________________________

Hike Highlights:

• Steep Climbs 1150 Ft of Vertical Over 1.25 Miles

• Overlook of Delaware River

• Dunnfield Creek Frozen Waterfalls

• Dunnfield Creek & Crossings

• Sunfish Pond


• The AT


This Hike Should Only Be Considered By Experienced Hikers.

______________________________


The Plan: (Subject To Change Based On Conditions)

We'll be heading up to the Delaware Water Gap for a popular, classic winter hike on Mount Tammany.


First, we'll climb up Mt Tammany for a view of the Delaware River and the "gap" from the NJ side. This round trip will be quite steep as we traverse the Red Dot and Blue Dot Trails. Then we'll head out along The Dunnfield Creek and if all goes well and we're making good time, then we will also head all the way out to Sunfish Pond and then return on The AT.


Red Dot (Tammany) Trail

This trail begins at the Dunnfield parking area and climbs a steep rocky grade to join the Blue-blazed atop Tammany (1.5 miles, 1250 ft. climb.)


Blue-blazed (Blue-dot) Trail:

This trail branches off the AT 1/2 mile north of Dunnfield parking area to join the Red Dot Trail (Tammany Trail ) atop Tammany. (Total 2.5 miles 1250 ft. climb.)


Dunnfield Hollow Trail (green blaze):

This trail branches off the AT 1/2 mile north of Dunnfield, crosses a footbridge to the east side of Dunnfield Creek, and then climbs and descends the flank of Mt. Tammany. We'll ford The Dunnfield Creek to meet Holly Spring Trail, a 1/2-mile red-blazed connector that climbs southwest past Holly Spring to the AT and Beulahland Trail. Green-blazes continue north 2 miles to SunfishPond. Some previous trail washouts may require several more fordings. We may take a route via Holly Spring / AT. (Total to AT / Holly Spring: about 2 miles, 1000 ft. climb Total from Dunnfield to Sunfish Pond: 4 miles, 1000 ft. climb. Climb is in 2 sections.)


Appalachian Trail (white blaze)

This will be the return trail from Sunfish Pond to the Dunnfield parking area. (Total: 3.75 miles)

_____________

Difficulty: Moderate - Difficult


Elevation change: 1150 feet over 1.25 miles during our initial climb.


Trailhead location: Dunnfield Creek Natural Area Parking Lot

Sturdy shoes are recommended. Dress appropriately for weather conditions...including extra layers, gloves, hats, rain gear and Micro Spikes/Trax For Boots.

Rain and thunder storms will cancel this hike. Snow may not cancel this hike (ON BAD WEATHER DAYS I WILL ALWAYS POST A HIKE STATUS IN COMMENTS AROUND 60-90 MINUTES PRIOR TO POSTED HIKE START TIME OR YOU CAN CALL/TEXT ME AT[masked] FOR AN UPDATE).

As always...PLEASE REMEMBER TO HYDRATE BEFORE THE HIKE AND BRING PLENTY OF WATER, snacks and other essential items you may need.

You may also want to consider bringing a hat, first aid kit, walking stick(s), field guides, binoculars, and a camera.

Dogs: Always Welcome (A Leash Is Recommended)

Note: Please add a comment if you do plan to bring along your pooch OR if you are ALLERGIC so that everyone is made aware in advance and can plan accordingly.

Arrival and Start Times: Please plan to arrive at the scheduled starting time for meet and greet introductions, hike overview and group count. We'll start the hike promptly at 15 Minutes after the scheduled arrival time.

Facilities: Bathrooms At Visitor Center at the main parking area.

__________________________


Trail Details and Descriptions:

The red dot trail is steep and rocky, with two main climbs, and two stunning overlooks. The first overlook is reached after a half-mile ascent of about two hundred feet, and grants views of Arrow Island and Mt. Minsi from about five hundred feet above the Delaware River. The second half of the ascent is considerably more difficult, and includes a steep, switchback scramble over boulders-but it is worth it! The second overlook may offer the finest view of the Gap and the surrounding area to be found in the park.

The Red-dot trail gives way shortly thereafter to the Blue-blazed trail, which is much more easily traversed. In a mile and a half, the blue gives way to a green blaze, and then to the white blaze of the Appalachian Trail, which will bring visitors back to the parking lot. Since the view is simply too good to pass up, using the Blue-blazed trail to go up AND down is an alternative to the Red-dot.


Many say Winter is the best time to hike Mt. Tammany at the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area.

It’s one of the park’s most popular hikes, and it’s easy to see why. All the work of this 1,400-foot climb is in the quick, but semi-steep trek to Tammany, which offers a beautiful, sweeping view of the sparkling blue Delaware River and the sea of white snow peaking out from the brown barren trees on the gentle rolling hills surrounding Pennsylvania’s Mt. Minsi. Painted green, the view is equally breathtaking in the summer.


</a> Dunnfield Creek tumbles down rocks near the end of this hike.

From the lot, we will take the red-dot Tammany Trail up steep wooden stairs as the cars whizzing by on Route 80 become smaller and smaller. When we get to the top, we'll follow the blue-blazed trail, which takes us along a ridge overlooking New Jersey’s Highlands region and through quiet woods down to Dunnfield Creek, which boasts two picturesque waterfalls.


The initial hike, just under four miles, can take about 2+ hours depending on the conditions.

Wearing layers plus a shell, gloves and a hat. The shell and gloves may came off early, during the uphill stretch to Tammany, but you may be putting them back on when we reach the windy summit. This is why layering in cold weather is essential.

The snow should be pretty well packed down along the trail. I recommend Yak Trax / MicroSpikes / IceTrekkers to help prevent any slips.

__________________________

NOTICE: By attending an event you are agreeing that YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY AT ALL TIMES. No member of the group EXCEPT YOURSELF can be held responsible for any damages, accidents, or liabilities incurred while hiking with us.

__________________________ </a>

Directions If Needed (From PA Turnpike I-476)


I-476 N toward Plymouth Mtg Partial toll road 41.8 mi

Take the exit toward Lehigh Valley Toll road

Keep right at the fork, follow signs for US-22 E/I-78 E/PA-309/Allentown and merge onto US-22 E Partial toll road 16.4 mi

Take the exit onto PA-33 N toward Stroudsburg 19.7 mi

Get on I-80 E in Arlington Heights 6.2 mi / 6 min

Continue onto US-209 N 6.0 mi

Take the interstate 80 E ramp to Stroudsburg 0.2 mi

Follow I-80 E to Hardwick

Exit from I-80 E - 6.8 mi

Merge onto I-80 E Entering New Jersey 6.7 mi

Take the exit

Destination will be on the right

results.description:
CONDITIONS UPDATE:  There is substantial snow cover in the woods, but it has been packed down.  The hike will start "crunchy" but soften up as the day goes on.  Traction devices are required and poles are strongly recommended.  If you have snowshoes, bring them along and you can make the decision whether to use them when you see the conditions in the morning.  Mileage will be shortened to accommodate reduced speed hiking through snow, but we will still hike for 2 hours with breaks as needed.  We will be hiking the more level trails on the east side of the reservation.  For information on traction devices, check out the Winter Hiking link on our website.   http://tsr.nynjtc.org/  

Leader: Pat Horsch, cell day of hike[masked]


Meet: 10 AM at Trailside Nature Center parking lot on Coles Ave.
We will do a 4- to 5-mile hike on leader’s choice of trails, approx. 2 hours. Easy to moderate terrain. Wear good boots with traction devices if needed. Bring water. Inclement weather cancels. Watch this site on the morning of January 30 for any last minute changes/cancellations.

DIRECTIONS:
Trailside Nature Center, Coordinates: N40° 40.97', W74° 22.38'
1.1. FROM LIVINGSTON: Take John F. Kennedy Parkway past the Short Hills Mall keep left, following signs
to SUMMIT and River Rd. Proceed 0.5 miles at light by Novartis, turn left onto Morris Ave. Continue 1.9 miles past Overlook Hospital as road bends to left. After passing the hospital, take the first right onto Glenside Ave. then in 0.1 miles bear left onto Baltusrol Rd (signs says US 22) road name changes to Summit Rd. After 1.1 miles, at light, turn right onto Summit Lane. At traffic circle, take the second right and proceed 0.5 miles further to a right turn onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.
1.2. ALTERNATIVE: VIA US ROUTE 22: Take Mountainside/New Providence Rd. exit (turn right from westbound lanes; jug-handle from eastbound lanes). Proceed uphill northwest bound for 0.7 miles (name changes to Deer Path) to the 5th right onto Ackerman Ave. In 0.4 miles at Tee intersection, turn right onto Coles Ave. Proceed 0.2 miles to Trailside Nature & Science Center parking lot on the left.
1.3. ALTERNATIVE: VIA I-78 EAST: Take Exit 44 (New Providence/Berkeley Heights). At light turn left onto Glenside Ave. Go 1.3 miles and turn right into the Watchung Reservation (CR 645 - W.R. Tracey Dr). Proceed past Lake Surprise, uphill and straight past loop picnic area. Bear left and continue 1.3 miles to traffic circle. At traffic circle take the first right and proceed 0.5 mile on Summit Lane. Turn right onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.

If this is your third meetup event with TSR we kindly ask that you join the club for $15 yearly membership with full access to our schedule which allows you to attend hikes and other outings 6 days a week. As a dues paying member of TSR you do not need to sign up for events and you do not have to be entered onto a waiting list. You can attend all events. Visit our website at tsr.nynjtc.org for an application and schedule preview.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at Trailside Nature Parking Lot
results.name: HIKE - Watchung Reservation, Mountainside, NJ

results.description:
A weekend workshop with Dr. Kristina Kincaid


Join us for the highest expression of a healed world, merging the Shechina and the Tiferet in Tantric Practice.

The lover's art most clearly modeled by the sexual is the merging of the masculine - line and feminine - circle energies, the two essential forces of the universe. In Chinese Taoist thought we would call these forces the yin and the yang. In Hinduism we speak of Shiva and his consort Shakti. Their union brings blessings to all the worlds. For the Hebrew mystic, Tiferet and Shechina are not disparate forces that occasionally come together for a one-night stand. Instead, they are different faces of the greater union, the force of divinity that courses through the cosmos and our own bodies. Their integration is the highest erotic expression of a healed world.

IN THIS WORKSHOP YOU WILL LEARN:

·  to deeply understand the powerful relationship between the masculine – line and feminine – circle energies

·  a tantric practice for merging line and circle energies

·  to ignite the divine power of the Shekinah and Tiferet in your own life

·  to access the full power of your circle and line energies as a tool for your liberation and empowerment

·  the difference between ordinary and extraordinary sexing

·  how “being a lover” is a commitment to the act of generosity and transcending the self

·  what is the “erotic” and what is “merely sexual”

·  to liberate eros in every dimension of your sexual and nonsexual life

·  to access the circle quality of surrender and why we will happily give up the illusion of control when we embrace the wisdom of eros

·  to navigate the razor’s edge between domination and submission as reflections of line and circle energies

·  to experience the inner alchemy of hieros gamos – an inner marriage as a path towards wholeness

Note: This workshop is for both couples and singles. It does not include nudity or explicit sexual touch. All genders and sexual preferences welcome.

Admission: $245 before Jan 17th, $295 after

Led by Dr. Kristina Kincaid
Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska

Tickets: 
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/merging-lines-and-circles-a-tantric-practice-for-the-outrageous-lover-tickets-20245387499


When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.

Bio:
Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Connect with us:

http://www.meetup.com/integral-evolutionary-tantra/


http://integralevolutionarytantra.com/
results.name: Merging Lines and Circles: A Tantric Practice for the Outrageous Lover

Hey, 

We're pushing you up the ladder. 

We'd like to invite you for a BIG Data & Hadoop 2.x Foundation Course featuring 6 hours of live training, 4 hours of practicals, 2 installation guides and 1 question bank to give you the perfect foundation. The following will be covered: 

• Complete Hadoop Stack - System Configurations & Dataflows 

• Data Loading via HDFS - Name Node & Data Node 

• BIG Data Analytics via MapReduce - Mapper, Reducer and Combiner 

• Running Queries via HiveQL; Complier & UDFs 

• What is YARN? YARN and HDFS Integration? 

It is scheduled for January 30th and 31st; 10:00AM to 1:00PM.

The registration fee for this course in only 43USD for the first 33 slots; after that the pricing will increase to 99USD. This is our second edition; the 1st one was sold out. :) 

Click here to register at 43USD. 

If you require any assistance, please click on the above link. You'll get all the details. 

Cheers!

results.description:
While permaculture design practices are typically applied to creating productive homes and agricultural land, permaculture design ethics and principles, when applied at the broader scales of community, regional, and urban planning, have a great impact on creating a human environment with ecological integrity. Starting with a clear understanding of the mistakes and challenges inherent in our present economy – including petroleum dependence and extreme weather -- this course focuses on how to redirect our society and its infrastructure back into alignment with the earth’s natural cycles, one region at a time. Ideal for architects, regional and city planners, community organizers, land trusts, watershed groups and local food advocates, this course will provide participants with the vision and tools for coordinating and synthesizing efforts for improving regional economies and the quality of life for future generations.

Registration [masked]

Pay with Paypal on our website! www.permaculturenewyork.com
results.name: Permaculture for Regional Planning-Ecological Models of Economic Development

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
